/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/1.content: If a worker's death results from or is materially (1A) This section does not apply in respect of a death occurring on or after 12 November 1997. contributed to by an injury which entitles the worker's dependants to compensation, the amount of the compensation must be determined—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/1/a.content: if a dependant does not have legal representation, or is a minor or a person under a disability, by the court in accordance with this section; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/1/b.content: in all other cases, by the Authority or self insurer in accordance with this section.5

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/2.content: If the worker leaves any dependants wholly or mainly dependent on the worker's earnings the amount of compensation shall be—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/2/a.content: the sum of $128 420; and substituted by No. 64/1989 s. 10. inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 26. amended by Nos 67/1992 s. 64(9)(a), 50/1993 s. 78(1)(c), 50/1994 s. 37(1), substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 67(1). amended by No. 7/1996 s. 49(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/b.content: the appropriate additional sum specified in Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 73 Column 2 of the Table to this subsection in the case of each child under the age and having the status specified in Column 1 of that Table who— (i) was wholly or mainly dependent on the earnings of the worker at the time of the death; or (ii) would, but for the incapacity of the worker prior to the worker's death, have been wholly or mainly dependent on the earnings of the worker at the time of death. Column 1 Years of Age Column 2 Amounts of Compensation $ Under 1 24 470 Under 2 22 870 Under 3 21 310 Under 4 19 720 Under 5 18 140 Under 6 16 540 Under 7 14 970 Under 8 13 410 Under 9 11 840 Under 10 10 260 Under 11 8 690 Under 12 7 120 Not under 12 but under 16 5 530 Not under 16 but under 21 (full-time student) 5 530 amended by No. 7/1996 s. 49(c).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/3.content: If the worker does not leave any dependants Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 74 wholly or mainly dependent on the worker's earnings but leaves any dependants partly dependent upon the worker's earnings, the amount of compensation shall be a sum not exceeding $128 420 which the court, Authority or self-insurer6 considers is reasonable and appropriate to the injury to those dependants.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/4.content: If the worker being under the age of 21 years at the time of the injury leaves no dependants but immediately before the injury was contributing towards the maintenance of the home of the members of the worker's family, the members of the worker's family shall be deemed to be dependants of the worker partly dependent on the worker's earnings and the amount of compensation shall be a sum not exceeding $128 420 which the court, the Authority or self-insurer7 considers is reasonable and appropriate to the injury to those dependants.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/5.content: In determining whether a spouse was wholly, mainly or in part dependent on the worker at the time of the death of the worker or other relevant time, no regard shall be had to any money which the spouse had earned or was earning by his or her own personal exertion or to any savings arising from any such earnings.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/6.content: If there are both total and partial dependants, the court, the Authority or self-insurer8 shall determine the amount of compensation payable and shall allot the compensation to the total dependants and to the partial dependants in such proportions as it determines. amended by Nos 67/1992 s. 64(9)(a), 50/1993 s. 78(1)(c), 50/1994 s. 37(1), 7/1996 s. 49(b), 9/2010 s. 67(2). amended by Nos 67/1992 s. 64(9)(a), 50/1993 s. 78(1)(c), 50/1994 s. 37(1), 7/1996 s. 49(b), 9/2010 s. 67(3). amended by Nos 67/1992 s. 64(9)(a), 50/1993 s. 78(1)(c), 50/1994 s. 37(1), 9/2010 s. 67(4).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/7.content: A dependant is entitled to interest at the Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 75 prescribed rate on an amount of compensation determined in accordance with this section—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/7/a.content: in the case of a determination by the court— in respect of the period beginning on the date the claim for compensation was lodged in accordance with section 103 and ending on the date of the determination; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92/7/b.content: in the case of a determination made by the Authority or self-insurer—in respect of the period beginning on the date the claim was lodged in accordance with section 103 and ending on the date the Authority or self-insurer makes the determination.9

self-insurer makes the determination.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/1.content: In this section— child means a person who—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/1/a.content: was a partner, parent, guardian, step-parent, grandparent, sibling or step-sibling of the worker or a person to whom the worker was a parent, step-parent or guardian; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/1/b.content: had a genuine personal relationship with the worker; substituted by No. 67/1992 s. 64(9)(b), amended by Nos 50/1993 s. 78(1)(c), 50/1994 s. 37(1), substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 67(5). inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 27(1). def. of child amended by No. 9/2010 s. 68(1). def. of close family member inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 43(1).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/a.content: one or more dependants, whether dependent partners or dependent children or partially dependent partners; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/b.content: any other person who is to any extent dependent on the worker's earnings— each person referred to in paragraph (b) is entitled to an amount of compensation, being a sum not exceeding $20 000, which the court, Authority or self-insurer considers is reasonable and appropriate to the injury to that person. (8D) To avoid doubt, a determination of the amount of compensation to which a dependant is entitled under subsection (4), (5), (6), (7), (8), (8A) or (8B) is not affected by, and does not affect, a determination of the amount of compensation to which a dependant is entitled under subsection (8C). inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 43(1A). inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 43(1A).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/2.content: In determining, for the purposes of this section, whether a partner was a dependent partner at the time of the death of the worker or other relevant time, no regard shall be had to any money which the partner had earned or was earning by his or her own personal exertion or to any savings arising from any such earnings. (2A) For the purposes of this section and section 92B, a partner who resided with the worker at the time of the worker's death is deemed to have been dependent on the earnings of the worker at the time of the worker's death. (2B) Subsection (2A) applies to all claims first received on and from 10 December 2009—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/2/a.content: by the Authority, whether forwarded by the employer or lodged by a partner to which that subsection applies; or def. of partially dependent partner inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 14(1)(b), substituted by No. 80/2010 s. 52(1)(b). amended by Nos 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.4(c)), 80/2010 s. 52(2). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 68(3). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 68(3).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/3.content: If a worker's death results from or is materially contributed to by an injury which entitles the worker's dependants to compensation, the amount of compensation must be determined—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/3/a.content: if a dependant does not have legal representation, or is a minor or a person under a disability, by the court in accordance with this section; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/3/b.content: in all other cases, by the Authority or self-insurer in accordance with this section.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/4.content: If the worker leaves a dependent partner, or dependent partners, and no dependent child, the amount of compensation is $555 350 payable to the dependent partner or, if there is more than one, in equal shares to the dependent partners.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/5.content: If the worker leaves no dependent partner and no dependent children other than an orphan child or orphan children, the amount of compensation is $555 350 payable to that orphan child or, if there are 2 or more, in equal shares for those children. substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 68(4). amended by Nos 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.4(d) (i)(ii)), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(c), 41/2006 s. 11(1), 9/2010 s. 68(5), 80/2010 s. 82(c), 67/2013 s. 632(c). amended by Nos 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.4(e)), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(c), 41/2006 s. 11(1), 9/2010 s. 68(5), 80/2010 s. 82(c), 67/2013 s. 632(c).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/6.content: If the worker leaves a dependent partner, or Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 79 dependent partners, and one, and only one, dependent child, the amount of compensation is $555 350 of which—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/6/a.content: $55 530 is payable to the dependent child; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/6/b.content: the balance— (i) is payable to the dependent partner; or (ii) if there is more than one dependent partner, is payable in equal shares to each of the dependent partners.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/7.content: If the worker leaves a dependent partner, or dependent partners, and more than one and not more than 5 dependent children, the amount of compensation is $555 350 payable in the following shares— amended by Nos 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.4(f) (i)(ii)), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(d)(e), 41/2006 s. 11(2)(3), 9/2010 s. 68(6), 80/2010 s. 82(d)(e), 67/2013 s. 632(d)(e), substituted by No. 67/2013 s. 628(3). amended by No. 44/2014 s. 27(1). amended by Nos 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.4(f) (i)(ii)), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(c), 41/2006 s. 11(1), 9/2010 s. 68(7)(a) (as amended by No. 80/2010 s. 159(l)(i)), 80/2010 s. 82(f), 67/2013 s. 632(f).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/8.content: If a worker leaves a dependent partner, or dependent partners, and more than 5 dependent children, the amount of compensation is $555 350 of which—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/8/a.content: $416 520 is payable— (i) to the dependent partner; or (ii) if there is more than one dependent partner, in equal shares to each of the dependent partners; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/8/b.content: the balance is payable to each of the dependent children in equal shares. amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(f), 41/2006 s. 11(4), 9/2010 s. 68(7)(b), 80/2010 s. 82(g), 67/2013 s. 632(g). amended by No. 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.4(f) (i)(ii)). amended by Nos 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.4(f) (i)(ii)), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(c)(g) (h), 41/2006 s. 11(1)(5)(6), 9/2010 s. 68(8)(a)-(c), 80/2010 s. 82(h)-(j), 67/2013 s. 632(h)-(j), substituted by No 44/2014 s. 27(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/c.content: one or more partially dependent partners or;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/d.content: one or more partially dependent partners and one or more dependants, whether dependent children or dependent partners— each such dependent is entitled to the amount of compensation, being a share of a sum not exceeding $555 350, which the court, the Authority or self-insurer considers is reasonable and appropriate to the injury to that dependant. (8C) If a worker leaves—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/9.content: If the worker does not leave any dependent Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 83 partner, dependent child or partially dependent partner but leaves any other person who is to any extent dependent on the worker's earnings, the amount of compensation is a sum not exceeding $555 350 which the court, Authority or self-insurer considers is reasonable and appropriate to the injury to that person or, if more than one, to those persons in such shares as the court, the Authority, or self-insurer determines.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/10.content: If the worker, being under the age of 21 years at the time of the injury, leaves no dependent partner, dependent child or partially dependent partner but, immediately before the injury, was contributing to the maintenance of the home of the members of the worker's family, the members of the worker's family are deemed to be dependants of the worker partly dependent on the worker's earnings.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/11.content: If, under this section, compensation is payable to a minor or a person under a disability, the compensation must be paid to a trustee for the minor or person under a disability appointed by the court to be invested, applied or otherwise dealt with for the benefit of the child as the trustee thinks fit. (11A) In addition to any other compensation paid under this section, the amount of compensation payable on the death of the worker to each close family member of the worker is $10 000. (11B) Subsection (3) does not apply to an amount of compensation payable under subsection (11A). amended by Nos 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.4(g)), 102/2004 ss 14(3), 38(1)(c), 41/2006 s. 11(1), 9/2010 s. 69(10), 80/2010 s. 82(k), 67/2013 s. 632(k). amended by Nos 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.4(g)), 102/2004 s. 14(3), 9/2010 s. 68(11). amended by No. 9/2010 s. 68(12). inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 43(2). inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 43(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/12.content: A claimant is entitled to interest at the prescribed Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 84 rate on an amount of compensation determined in accordance with this section—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/12/a.content: in the case of a determination by the court— in respect of the period beginning on the date the claim for compensation was lodged in accordance with section 103 and ending on the date of the determination; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92A/12/b.content: in the case of a determination by the Authority or self-insurer—in respect of the period beginning on the date the claim was lodged in accordance with section 103 and ending on the date the Authority or self-insurer makes the determination.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA.title: Reimbursement of expenses incurred by non-

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/1.content: In this section— dependent family members of a deceased worker expenses does not include—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/1/a.content: the cost of any service or contribution that may be claimed under Division 2B of Part IV;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/1/b.content: the legal or other costs of a member of the deceased worker's family incurred by that person as a result of a dispute arising from the deceased worker's will, or the distribution of the deceased worker's estate;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/1/c.content: an expense incurred as a result of the loss of a service provided to a member of the deceased worker's family; substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 68(13). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 69. def. of expenses amended by No. 80/2010 ss 53(1)(a), 78(c).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/2.content: If a worker's death results from, or is materially Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 85 maximum amount means an amount of $33 120 in total for expenses incurred as a result of a worker's death, regardless of how many members of the deceased worker's family apply under this section. contributed to by, an injury arising out of or in the course of employment and if—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/2/a.content: had the worker had a dependant, or dependants at the time of his or her death, the injury would have entitled that dependant or dependants to compensation under this Act; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/2/b.content: the worker did not have any dependants at the time of his or her death— a member of the worker's family may apply to the Magistrates' Court for an order that the Authority or a self-insurer (as appropriate) reimburse the applicant for expenses incurred as a result of the worker's death.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/3.content: An application under this section must—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/3/a.content: specify the expenses of the applicant incurred as a result of the death of the worker and how the incurring of those expenses caused financial hardship to the applicant;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/3/b.content: be made within 2 years after the date of the worker's death unless subsection (4) applies.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/4.content: The Magistrates' Court may grant leave to an applicant to apply out of time, if the applicant has a special excuse for not making the application within time. def. of maximum amount amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(l), 67/2013 s. 632(l). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 53(1)(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/5.content: On application under this section, the Magistrates' Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 86 Court may, in its discretion, order that the Authority or a self-insurer reimburse an applicant for expenses not exceeding the maximum amount if the Court is satisfied that—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/5/a.content: the expenses incurred by the applicant were as a result of the death of the worker; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/5/b.content: the expenses were reasonably incurred and are of a reasonable amount; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/5/c.content: the incurring of the expenses caused financial hardship to the applicant.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/6.content: In making an order under this section, the Magistrates' Court may order that more than one applicant in respect of a deceased worker be reimbursed by the Authority or self-insurer under this section however the total amount ordered to be reimbursed in respect of the deceased worker must not exceed the maximum amount regardless of how many applicants apply in respect of that deceased worker.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/7.content: The Magistrates' Court must not award any interest if making an order for reimbursement of an applicant under this section.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/8.content: A reimbursement of expenses under this section is not a payment of compensation under this Act except for the purposes of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/8/b.content: contributions under Division 6A of Part IV;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/8/c.content: seeking indemnity from a third party under section 138 or any other indemnity under this Act;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92AA/8/d.content: seeking a refund of payments under section 249A or any other amount relating to the recovery of payments under this Act. amended by No. 80/2010 s. 53(1)(c). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 53(1)(d).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B.title: Weekly pensions for dependants of worker who dies
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B.content:
Accident Compensation Act 1985 
No. 10191 of 1985 
93   
 * * * * * 
 (11) The total amount of weekly pensions payable to 
the dependent partner, dependent partners and the 
dependent child or dependent children of a worker 
under— 
 (a) subsections (3)(b) and (7) or (8); or 
 (b) subsections (4)(b) and (7) or (8)— 
must not exceed twice the State average weekly 
earnings. 
 * * * * *

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/1.content: Subject to subsection (1A), words and expressions defined in section 92A have the same meaning in this section as in that section. (1A) In this section, child includes a person who is 16 years or more but under the age of 25 years if the person has a disability within the meaning of section 3(1) of the Disability Act 2006.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/2.content: In addition to compensation under section 92A, compensation in the form of weekly payments of pension is payable subject to and in accordance with this section.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/3.content: If the worker leaves one, and only one, dependent partner, the partner is entitled to a weekly pension at the rate of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/3/a.content: during the first 13 weeks after death— (i) 95 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or (ii) twice the State average weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/3/b.content: from the end of the first 13 weeks after the death until the end of 3 years after the death— inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 27(1). amended by No. 10/2022 s. 4(1). inserted by No. 10/2022 s. 4(2), amended by No. 41/2025 s. 3(Sch. 1 item 2). amended by No. 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.5(a)). amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/4.content: If the worker leaves 2 or more dependent partners, Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 88 (i) unless subparagraph (ii) or (iii) applies, 50 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings or twice the State average weekly earnings, whichever is the lesser; or (ii) if the worker leaves not more than 4 dependent children who are entitled to a pension under this section and subsection (11) applies, an amount calculated in accordance with the formula— twice the State average weekly earnings × 50 50 + 12·5N where— N is the number of dependent children so entitled; or (iii) if the worker leaves more than 4 dependent children who are entitled to a pension under this section and subsection (11) applies, 50 per cent of twice the State average weekly earnings. each partner is entitled to a weekly pension at the rate of an equal of share of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/4/a.content: during the first 13 weeks after death— (i) 95 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or (ii) twice the State average weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser; and amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1). amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1), 27/2025 s. 54(1)(a). amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(j), 9/2010 s. 39(2), 27/2025 s. 54(1)(b). amended by No. 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.5(b)). amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/b.content: if subsection (11) applies, 50 per cent of Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 92 twice the State average weekly earnings.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/5.content: If the worker leaves no dependent child other than one, and only one, orphan child, the orphan child is entitled, subject to this section, to a weekly pension at the rate of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/5/a.content: during the first 13 weeks after the death or until the orphan child ceases to be eligible, whichever first occurs— (i) 95 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1). amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1), 27/2025 s. 54(2)(a). amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(j), 9/2010 s. 39(2), 27/2025 s. 54(2)(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/6.content: If the worker leaves no dependent children other than 2 or more orphan children, each such child is entitled, subject to this section, to a weekly pension at the rate of an equal share of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/6/a.content: during the first 13 weeks after the death or until the orphan child ceases to be eligible, whichever first occurs— (i) 95 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or (ii) twice the State average weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/6/b.content: if still eligible, from the end of the first 13 weeks after the death until the orphan child ceases to be eligible— amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1). amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1). amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/7.content: If the worker leaves not more than 4 dependent Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 91 (i) 50 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or (ii) twice the State average weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser. children, each such child is entitled, from the end of the first 13 weeks after the death until the child ceases to be eligible, to a weekly pension at the rate of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/7/a.content: unless subsection (11) applies, 12·5 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/7/b.content: if subsection (11) applies, an amount calculated in accordance with the formula— twice the State average weekly earnings × 12·5 50 + 12·5N where— N is the number of dependent children so entitled.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/8.content: If a worker leaves more than 4 dependent children, each such child is entitled, from the end of the first 13 weeks after the death until the child ceases to be eligible, to a weekly pension at the rate of an equal share of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/8/a.content: unless subsection (11) applies, 50 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or amended by No. 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1). amended by No. 27/2025 s. 54(3)(a). amended by No. 27/2025 s. 54(3)(b). amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1), 27/2025 s. 54(3)(c). amended by No. 27/2025 s. 54(4)(a). amended by No. 27/2025 s. 54(4)(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/9.content: A child ceases to be eligible under this section—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/9/a.content: a child does not cease to be a full-time student or a full-time apprentice if that child ceases to be a student in order to become an apprentice;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/9/ab.content: if the child has a disability within the meaning of section 3(1) of the Disability Act 2006, on attaining the age of 25 years; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/9/b.content: a child does not cease to be a full-time student or a full-time apprentice if that child ceases to be an apprentice in order to become a student;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/9/c.content: if a child attains the age of 25 years before ceasing to be a full-time student or full-time apprentice, the child remains eligible under this section until the end of the calendar year in which the child attains the age of 25. amended by Nos 102/2004 s. 38(1)(k), 9/2010 s. 39(3), 27/2025 s. 54(4)(c). substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 70(1). inserted by No. 10/2022 s. 4(3). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 70(1).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/11.content: The total amount of weekly pensions payable to Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 93 * * * * * the dependent partner, dependent partners and the dependent child or dependent children of a worker under—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92B/11/b.content: subsections (4)(b) and (7) or (8)— must not exceed twice the State average weekly earnings. * * * * *

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/1.content: A weekly pension under section 92B must be paid by fortnightly, monthly, quarterly or annual instalments in accordance with this section, as the Authority, employer or self-insurer determines.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/2.content: The first payment of amounts due as weekly pension must be made within 14 days after the amount is determined and subsequent amounts are payable—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/2/a.content: on the 1st and 15th days of each month; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/2/b.content: on the 1st day of each month; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/2/c.content: on 1 January, 1 April, 1 July and 1 September in each year; or repealed by No. 9/2010 s. 70(2). amended by Nos 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.5(c)), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), 9/2010 s. 39(1), substituted by No. 67/2013 s. 629(1). inserted by No. 80/2010 s. 53(2), repealed by No. 67/2013 s. 629(2). inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 27(1). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(a).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/d.content: on 1 July in each year— Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 94 as the case requires, and must be paid within 7 days.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/3.content: A weekly pension to which a child under the age of 18 is entitled is payable to—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/3/a.content: the parent of the child who has custody of the child; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/3/b.content: if there is no such person, the child's guardian; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/3/c.content: if there is no person referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), the person who has day to day care and control of the child and with whom the child is ordinarily resident.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/4.content: A payment of a weekly pension may be made by post by properly addressing, prepaying and posting to the person entitled to the weekly pension a letter containing a cheque for the amount.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/5.content: A payment of a weekly pension in accordance with subsection (4) is deemed to have been made when the letter was posted.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/6.content: The liability to the person entitled to a weekly pension is not satisfied until the person receives the amount.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92C/7.content: If the Authority, employer or self-insurer fails to make a payment before the end of the period within which it is required by this section to be paid, the Authority, employer or self-insurer must make the payment together with interest calculated at the prescribed rate in respect of the period beginning when the payment was first payable and ending on the day before the payment was made. substituted by No. 27/2001 s. 4(Sch. 2 item 1.6). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(a).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D.title: Provisional payment
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D.content:
Accident Compensation Act 1985 
No. 10191 of 1985 
99   
 (c) seeking any order under the Administrative 
Law Act 1978; 
 (d) any other action or proceeding.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/1.content: Subject to subsection (7), if it appears to the Authority or self-insurer that a person may be entitled to compensation in respect of the death of the worker, the Authority or self-insurer may make provisional payments to the person as follows—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/1/a.content: weekly pension that may be payable under section 92B(3)(a) for a period of up to 13 weeks from the date of death of the worker;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/1/ab.content: weekly pension that may be payable under section 92B(3)(b) for a period from the end of the first 13 weeks after the death of the worker until the end of 26 weeks after the death of the worker;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/1/b.content: medical and other costs that may be payable under section 99(1)(a) up to a maximum of $8270;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/1/c.content: family counselling, therapy and other support services costs that may be payable under section 99(1)(b) up to the maximum prescribed in that section;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/1/d.content: the costs of the deceased worker's burial or cremation that may be payable under section 99(1)(c) up to the maximum amount determined as reasonable costs by the Authority under section 99AAA(2);

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/1/e.content: reasonable travelling or accommodation expenses that may be payable under section 99(1)(d) up to the maximum prescribed in that section; inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 71. amended by No. 27/2025 s. 44(1). inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 44(2). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(m), 67/2013 s. 632(m). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 78(d), 27/2025 s. 44(3). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 78(e), 67/2013 s. 630(1)(a), 49/2018 s. 39(1). inserted by No. 49/2018 s. 39(2), amended by No. 27/2025 s. 44(4).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/f.content: reasonable costs of forensic cleaning that Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 96 may be payable under section 99(1)(e) up to the maximum amount determined as reasonable costs by the Authority under section 99AAA(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/2.content: Except as provided by subsection (3), a provisional payment made under a paragraph in subsection (1) may be paid to more than one person however the total paid in respect of a deceased worker must not exceed the maximum set out in the relevant paragraph under that subsection regardless of how many persons receive provisional payments.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/3.content: Only one partner of a deceased worker may receive provisional payments under subsection (1)(a) or (ab).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/4.content: A provisional payment made under this section is not a payment of compensation under this Act except for the purposes of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/4/b.content: contributions under Division 6A of Part IV;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/4/c.content: the reduction of common law damages under section 135C(7)(a);

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/4/d.content: seeking indemnity from a third party under section 138 or any other indemnity under this Act;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/4/e.content: seeking a refund of payments under section 249A or any other amount relating to the recovery of payments under this Act.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/5.content: A decision made by the Authority or self-insurer to make provisional payments under this section is not an admission of liability to pay compensation under this Act. inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 44(5). amended by No. 27/2025 s. 44(6). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 54(a). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 54(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/6.content: If liability to pay compensation in respect of the Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 97 death of a worker is accepted, or determined by a court to be payable, after a provisional payment has been made to a person—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/6/a.content: under subsection (1)(a), any liability the Authority or self-insurer has to the person to whom the payment was made under section 92B(3)(a) or 92B(4)(a) is discharged to the extent of that payment;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/6/ab.content: under subsection (1)(ab), any liability the Authority or self-insurer has to the person to whom the payment was made under section 92B(3)(b) is discharged to the extent of that payment;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/6/b.content: under subsection (1)(b), any liability the Authority or self-insurer has under section 99(1)(a) is discharged to the extent of that payment;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/6/c.content: under subsection (1)(c), any liability the Authority or self-insurer has under section 99(1)(b) is discharged to the extent of that payment;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/6/d.content: under subsection (1)(d), any liability the Authority or self-insurer has under section 99(1)(c) is discharged to the extent of that payment;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/6/e.content: under subsection (1)(e), any liability the Authority or self-insurer has to the person to whom the payment was made under section 99(1)(d) is discharged to the extent of that payment;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/6/f.content: under subsection (1)(f), any liability the Authority or self-insurer has to the person to whom the payment was made under section 99(1)(e) is discharged to the extent of that payment. inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 44(7)(a). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 78(d). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 78(e), 27/2025 s. 44(7)(b). inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 44(7)(c). inserted by No. 27/2025 s. 44(7)(c).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/7.content: The Authority or self-insurer must not make Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 98 provisional payments to a person under this section in respect of the death of the worker if it appears to the Authority or self-insurer that the worker's death resulted from or was materially contributed to by a heart attack injury, disease or stroke injury unless at the time of the worker's death—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/7/a.content: the Authority or the self-insurer had already accepted a claim for compensation made by the worker in respect of that injury or disease; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/7/b.content: the worker was receiving compensation payments in respect of that injury or disease. (7A) If, under subsection (7), a provisional payment is payable to a minor or a person under a disability, the provisional payment must be paid to a trustee for the minor or person under a disability appointed by the court or VCAT to be invested, applied or otherwise dealt with for the benefit of the minor or person under a disability as the trustee thinks fit.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/8.content: The Authority may issue guidelines for the purposes of this section relating to the process to be observed by the Authority or self-insurer when acting under this section.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/9.content: Proceedings must not be brought in respect of any question or matter arising out of a decision of the Authority or self-insurer under this section.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/10/a.content: the inquiry into, hearing and determination of any question or matter under this Act;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/10/b.content: seeking the grant of any relief or remedy in the nature of certiorari, prohibition, mandamus or quo warranto, or the grant of a declaration of right or an injunction; amended by No. 10/2022 s. 5(1), substituted by No. 27/2025 s. 44(8). inserted by No. 10/2022 s. 5(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s92D/c.content: seeking any order under the Administrative Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 99 Law Act 1978;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93.title: Compensation in weekly payments
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93.content:
If a worker's incapacity for work results from, 
or is materially contributed to by, an injury 
which entitles the worker to compensation, the 
compensation shall be in the form of weekly 
payments subject to and in accordance with this 
Part.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93A.title: Weekly payments in first entitlement period
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93A.content:
Accident Compensation Act 1985 
No. 10191 of 1985 
102   
 (b) if the worker has a current work capacity or 
has no current work capacity but has current 
weekly earnings, at the rate of— 
 (i) the difference between 95 per cent of 
the worker's pre-injury average weekly 
earnings, less the deductible amount 
and the worker's current weekly 
earnings; or 
 (ii) the difference between twice the State 
average weekly earnings and the 
worker's current weekly earnings— 
whichever is the lesser.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93A/1.content: In relation to a claim for compensation in the form of weekly payments made by a pre-12 November 1997 claimant, the worker is entitled, subject to and in accordance with this Part and Part VIIB, while incapacitated for work during the first entitlement period, to weekly payments—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93A/1/a.content: if the worker has no current work capacity and no current weekly earnings, at the rate of— (i) 95 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or (ii) $1210— whichever is the lesser; substituted by No. 64/1989 s. 10. inserted by No. 64/1989 s. 10, substituted by No. 67/1992 s. 15, amended by Nos 50/1993 ss 78(1)(d), 91(a)(b), 50/1994 s. 38(1), 7/1996 s. 49(a), 81/1998 s. 23(b), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(l), substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 31. amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(b). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(n), 67/2013 s. 632(n).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93A/b.content: if the worker has a current work capacity or Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 102 has no current work capacity but has current weekly earnings, at the rate of— (i) the difference between 95 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings, less the deductible amount and the worker's current weekly earnings; or (ii) the difference between twice the State average weekly earnings and the worker's current weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93A/2.content: In relation to a claim by a worker for compensation in the form of weekly payments first made in respect of the injury to which the claim relates on or after 12 November 1997 and before 5 April 2010, the worker is entitled, subject to and in accordance with this Part and Part VIIB, while incapacitated for work during the first entitlement period, to weekly payments—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93A/2/a.content: if the worker has no current work capacity and no current weekly earnings, at the rate of— (i) 95 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or (ii) $1510— whichever is the lesser; amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(c). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(n), 67/2013 s. 632(n). amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(d). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(o), 67/2013 s. 632(o).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93A/3.content: In relation to a claim by a worker for compensation in the form of weekly payments first made in respect of the injury to which the claim relates on or after 5 April 2010, the worker is entitled, subject to and in accordance with this Part and Part VIIB, while incapacitated for work during the first entitlement period, to weekly payments—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93A/3/a.content: if the worker has no current work capacity and no current weekly earnings, at the rate of— (i) 95 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings, less the deductible amount; or (ii) twice the State average weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser; amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(e). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(o), 67/2013 s. 632(o). amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(f). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 50(2)(a).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93B.title: Weekly payments in second entitlement period

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93B/1.content: In relation to a claim made by a pre-12 November 1997 claimant for compensation in the form of weekly payments, the worker is entitled, subject to and in accordance with this Part and Part VIIB, while incapacitated for work during the second entitlement period, to weekly payments—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93B/1/a.content: if the worker has a serious injury, at the rate of— (i) the difference between 90 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings and 90 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings; or amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(g). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 50(2)(b). inserted by No. 64/1989 s. 10, substituted by No. 67/1992 s. 15, amended by Nos 50/1993 ss 78(1)(c)(d), 91(c)(d), 50/1994 s. 38(2)(3), 7/1996 ss 16(1), 49(a)(d), 60/1996 ss 10, 11(1), 81/1998 s. 23(a)(b), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(l)-(n), 41/2006 s. 13(1), substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 31 (as amended by No. 80/2010 s. 159(d)).10

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93B/b.content: if the worker has a current work capacity or has no current work capacity but has current weekly earnings, at the rate of— (i) the difference between 80 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings, less the deductible amount and 80 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings; or (ii) the difference between twice the State average weekly earnings and 80 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser. amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(l). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 50(2)(c). amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(m). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 50(2)(d).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93B/c.content: if the worker does not have a serious injury but has a current work capacity or has no current work capacity but has current weekly earnings, at the rate of— (i) the difference between 80 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings and 80 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings; or (ii) the difference between $1210 and 80 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93B/2.content: In relation to a claim by a worker for compensation in the form of weekly payments first made in respect of the injury to which the claim relates on or after 12 November 1997 and before 5 April 2010, the worker is entitled, subject to and in accordance with this Part and Part VIIB, amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(p), 67/2013 s. 632(p). amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(h). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(p), 67/2013 s. 632(p). amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(i). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(p), 67/2013 s. 632(p).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93B/a.content: if the worker has no current work capacity Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 105 and no current weekly earnings, at the rate of— (i) 80 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings, less the deductible amount; or (ii) twice the State average weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93B/3.content: In relation to a claim by a worker for compensation in the form of weekly payments first made in respect of the injury to which the claim relates on or after 5 April 2010, the worker is entitled, subject to and in accordance with this Part and Part VIIB, while incapacitated for work during the second entitlement period, to weekly payments— amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(j). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(q), 67/2013 s. 632(q). amended by No. 67/2013 s. 630(1)(k). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(q), 67/2013 s. 632(q).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C.title: Weekly payments after the second entitlement
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C.content:
Accident Compensation Act 1985 
No. 10191 of 1985 
109   
 (ii) the difference between twice the State 
average weekly earnings and, if the 
worker has current weekly earnings, 
80 per cent of those current weekly 
earnings— 
whichever is the lesser. 
 (3) A review of the assessment of a worker to whom 
subsection (1)(a) or (b) applies may be conducted 
by the Authority or self-insurer at any time and 
must be conducted as often as may reasonably be 
necessary and in any event at least once every 
2 years. 
 (4) In the case of a worker referred to in 
subsection (1)(c) who is receiving compensation 
under subsection (2), the Authority or self-
insurer— 
 (a) may review the work capacity of the worker 
at any time; and  
 (b) must review the work capacity of the worker 
as often as reasonably necessary and not less 
than once every 2 years.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/1.content: Subject to section 93CD, a worker's entitlement period to compensation in the form of weekly payments under this Part ceases upon the expiry of the second entitlement period unless—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/1/a.content: subject to paragraph (c), the worker is assessed by the Authority or self-insurer as having no current work capacity and likely to continue indefinitely to have no current work capacity; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/1/b.content: the worker is a pre-12 November 1997 claimant who has a serious injury; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/1/c.content: in the case of a worker whose second entitlement period expires on or after 31 March 2024, the Authority or self-insurer determines in accordance with Subdivision 1A of Division 2 of Part 5 of the Workplace Injury Rehabilitation and Compensation Act 2013 that the worker— inserted by No. 64/1989 s. 10, substituted by No. 67/1992 s. 15, amended by Nos 50/1993 s. 78(1)(c), 7/1996 s. 49(a)(d), substituted by No. 107/1997 s. 28, amended by Nos 81/1998 ss 23(a), 28, 102/2004 s. 20, 41/2006 s. 5(3), substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 31. substituted by No. 8/2024 s. 27(1). amended by No. 27/2025 s. 45.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/2.content: A worker to whom subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c) Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 107 (i) has no current work capacity and is likely to continue indefinitely to have no current work capacity; and (ii) has a whole person impairment of more than 20 per cent. applies is entitled, subject to and in accordance with this Part and Part VIIB, to compensation in the form of weekly payments—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/2/a.content: if the worker is a pre-12 November 1997 claimant who has a serious injury, at the rate of— (i) the difference between 90 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings and 90 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings; or (ii) the difference between $1210 and 90 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/2/b.content: if the worker is a pre-12 November 1997 claimant who does not have a serious injury, at the rate of— (i) the difference between 80 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings and, if the worker has current weekly earnings, 80 percent of those current weekly earnings; or amended by No. 8/2024 s. 27(2). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(r), 67/2013 s. 632(r) (as amended by No. 44/2014 s. 24(29)). amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(r), 67/2013 s. 632(r), substituted by No. 67/2013 s. 630(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/c.content: in the case of a claim for compensation in Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 108 (ii) the difference between $1210 and, if the worker has current weekly earnings, 80 per cent of those current weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser; the form of weekly payments first made in respect of the injury to which the claim relates on or after 12 November 1997 and before 5 April 2010 at the rate of— (i) the difference between 80 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings and, if the worker has current weekly earnings, 80 per cent of those earnings; or (ii) the difference between $1510 and, if the worker has current weekly earnings, 80 per cent of those current weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/d.content: in the case of a claim for compensation in the form of weekly payments first made in respect of the injury to which the claim relates on or after 5 April 2010 at the rate of— (i) the difference between 80 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings, less the deductible amount and, if the worker has current weekly earnings, 80 per cent of those earnings; or amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(s), 67/2013 s. 632(s), substituted by No. 67/2013 s. 630(2). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 50(2)(e), substituted by No. 67/2013 s. 630(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/3.content: A review of the assessment of a worker to whom Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 109 (ii) the difference between twice the State average weekly earnings and, if the worker has current weekly earnings, 80 per cent of those current weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser. subsection (1)(a) or (b) applies may be conducted by the Authority or self-insurer at any time and must be conducted as often as may reasonably be necessary and in any event at least once every 2 years.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/4.content: In the case of a worker referred to in subsection (1)(c) who is receiving compensation under subsection (2), the Authority or self- insurer—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/4/a.content: may review the work capacity of the worker at any time; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93C/4/b.content: must review the work capacity of the worker as often as reasonably necessary and not less than once every 2 years.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA.title: Compensation for incapacity arising from surgery

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/1.content: A worker may apply, in a form approved by the Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 112 93CAB Review of impairment arising from surgery after second entitlement period Authority, to the Authority or self-insurer for compensation in the form of weekly payments in respect of incapacity and whole person impairment if the worker—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/1/a.content: has an injury arising on or after 5 April 2010 in respect of which— (i) liability has been accepted or established; and (ii) the worker is, or has been, entitled under this Act to compensation in the form of weekly payments during the second entitlement period; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/1/b.content: either, in respect of the injury— (i) is not entitled to compensation in the form of weekly payments because of section 93C; or (ii) is entitled under section 93CD to compensation in the form of weekly payments; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/c.content: has returned to work for a period of not less Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 110 than 15 hours per week and is in receipt of current weekly earnings, or current weekly earnings together with a deductible amount, of at least $177 per week; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/d.content: either, in respect of the injury— (i) is not entitled to compensation in the form of weekly payments because of section 93C; or (ii) is entitled under section 93CD to compensation in the form of weekly payments; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/e.content: suffers incapacity and whole person Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 113 impairment resulting from or materially contributed to by the subsequent surgery; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/g.content: suffers incapacity resulting from or materially contributed to by the subsequent surgery; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/2.content: A worker who applies under this section is entitled to compensation in the form of weekly payments under section 93C(2)(d) if the Authority or self-insurer determines in accordance with Subdivision 1A of Division 2 of Part 5 of the Workplace Injury Rehabilitation and Compensation Act 2013 that the worker, as a result of the subsequent surgery—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/3.content: Compensation payable under this section is payable from—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/4.content: Unless the worker to whom this section applies is Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 111 incapacity resulting from or materially contributed to by the subsequent surgery. receiving weekly payments under section 93CD—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/4/a.content: the worker is not entitled to compensation in the form of weekly payments under this section in respect of the first 13 consecutive weeks after the expiry of the second entitlement period; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/4/b.content: an application under subsection (3) must not be made during the period of 13 consecutive weeks immediately after the expiry of the second entitlement period.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/5.content: Compensation in the form of weekly payments under this section is payable at the rate that would have been applicable under section 93B if the second entitlement period had not expired—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/5/a.content: in respect of the period of incapacity resulting from or materially contributed to by the subsequent surgery; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/5/b.content: if the worker has an incapacity resulting from, or materially contributed to, by the subsequent surgery for the period of 13 consecutive weeks commencing on the day on which the subsequent surgery is performed— whichever is the shorter.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/6.content: Within 14 days after receiving an application in accordance with this section, the Authority or self-insurer must—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/6/a.content: approve or reject the application; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/6/b.content: give the worker written notice of its decision including, in the case of rejection, a statement of the reasons for the decision.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/1/c.content: for at least 13 consecutive weeks immediately after the expiry of the second entitlement period, has not received compensation in the form of weekly payments other than weekly payments under section 93CD; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/1/d.content: requires surgery for that injury (the subsequent surgery) for which the Authority or self-insurer has accepted liability under section 99; and inserted by No. 8/2024 s. 28.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/2/a.content: has no current work capacity and is likely to continue indefinitely to have no current work capacity; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/2/b.content: has a whole person impairment of more than 20 per cent.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/3/a.content: if the worker receives compensation under section 93CA as a result of the subsequent surgery, the date that is 13 consecutive weeks after the day on which the subsequent surgery was performed; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CA/3/b.content: in any other case, the date that it is determined that the worker is entitled to compensation.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD.title: Continuation of weekly payments after second

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/1.content: A worker who receives weekly payments under section 93CD does not cease to be entitled to weekly payments under that section by reason only that the worker occasionally, but not during more than 4 weeks in the first period of 12 consecutive weeks immediately after the worker first received weekly payments under that section, or in any subsequent consecutive period of 12 weeks—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/2.content: A reference in subsection (1) to hours of work does not include hours of leave approved by the employer. * * * * * (1)(d) amended by No. 67/2013 s. 632(x). inserted by No. 64/1989 s. 10, amended by No. 18/1991 s. 12(1)(g), substituted by No. 67/1992 s. 15, amended by Nos 50/1993 s. 92, 50/1994 s. 38(4), 107/1997 s. 30(6), repealed by No. 9/2010 s. 128.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/2/a.content: if liability to pay the weekly payments lies with the employer (not being a self-insurer or a subsidiary of a self-insurer) or the Authority—to the Authority; inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 29, amended by Nos 81/1998 s. 23(b), 102/2004 ss 21, 38(1)(i)(o), 41/2006 ss 5(4), 13(2), repealed by No. 9/2010 s. 31. inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 29, amended by Nos 81/1998 s. 23(a)(b), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(i), repealed by No. 9/2010 s. 31. inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 29, amended by Nos 81/1998 s. 23(c), 102/2004 s. 38(1)(o)(p), 41/2006 s. 13(3), substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 34.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/b.content: has worked fewer hours during a week Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 118 (even if the number of hours worked is less than 15); or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/3.content: If the Authority or self-insurer receives an application under subsection (1), the Authority or self-insurer must, within 28 days after receiving the application—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/3/a.content: approve or reject the application; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/3/b.content: advise the worker in writing of its determination; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/3/c.content: if the Authority or self-insurer rejects the application, give the worker a statement of the reasons for its determination.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/4.content: The Authority or self-insurer must not approve an application under subsection (1) unless it is satisfied that—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/4/a.content: the worker has returned to work (whether in self-employment or other employment) for a period of not less than 15 hours per week and is in receipt of current weekly earnings, or current weekly earnings together with non-pecuniary benefits within the meaning of section 5AB(1)(d), of at least $177 per week; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/4/b.content: because of the injury, the worker is, and is likely to continue indefinitely to be, incapable of undertaking further additional employment or work which would increase the worker's current weekly earnings; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/4/c.content: in the case of a worker whose second entitlement period expires on or after 31 March 2024, the worker has a whole person impairment of more than 20 per cent. amended by Nos 80/2010 ss 50(2)(g), 82(u), 67/2013 s. 632(u). amended by No. 8/2024 s. 29(a). inserted by No. 8/2024 s. 29(b), amended by No. 27/2025 s. 46.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/5.content: If the Authority or self-insurer approves an Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 116 application made under subsection (1), the worker's entitlement to compensation in the form of weekly payments commences on the date the Authority or self-insurer received the application and, subject to and in accordance with this Part and Part VIIB, the worker is entitled to weekly payments at the rate of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/5/a.content: in the case of a pre-12 November 1997 claimant— (i) the difference between 80 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings and 80 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings; or (ii) the difference between $1210 and 80 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/5/b.content: in the case of a worker whose claim was first given, served or lodged on or after 12 November 1997 and before 5 April 2010— (i) the difference between 80 per cent of the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings and 80 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings; or (ii) the difference between $1510 and 80 per cent of the worker's current weekly earnings— whichever is the lesser; (a)(ii) amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(v), 67/2013 s. 632(v). (b)(ii) amended by Nos 80/2010 s. 82(w), 67/2013 s. 632(w).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/c.content: has received higher current weekly earnings; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/6.content: A worker continues to be entitled to compensation in the form of weekly payments under subsection (5) until—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/6/a.content: subject to section 93CDA, the Authority or self-insurer ceases to be satisfied as to the matters referred to in subsection (4); or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/6/b.content: the worker otherwise ceases to be entitled to compensation in the form of weekly payments. 93CDA Entitlement under section 93CD not affected by certain circumstances

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/1/a.content: has worked more hours during a week; or (c)(i) amended by No. 80/2010 s. 50(2)(h). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 35.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CD/d.content: has received lower current weekly earnings (even if the earnings are less than $177 per week)— than the hours worked, or the current weekly earnings received, at the time of making the application for payments under section 93CD.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE.title: Compensation in the form of superannuation
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE.content:

123

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/1/a.content: there is caused to a worker an injury arising out of, or in the course of employment; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/1/b.content: compensation in the form of weekly payments— (i) has been paid or is payable to the worker in respect of that injury for an aggregate period of 52 weeks (whether or not consecutive); and (ii) has not ceased to be paid or payable in respect of that injury; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/1/c.content: the worker has not attained retirement age— the Authority or self-insurer must, subject to the worker nominating a complying fund to the Authority or self-insurer and providing details of his or her tax file number to the trustee of the nominated complying fund within 3 months of receipt of a notice under subsection (4), pay, in accordance with this section, for the benefit of the worker, compensation in the form of inserted by No. 50/1994 s. 39, amended by Nos 7/1996 s. 16(2), 60/1996 s. 12, 107/1997 s. 30(6)(7), 102/2004 s. 22, repealed by No. 9/2010 s. 36. inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 37. amended by No. 73/2016 s. 4.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/2.content: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 120 superannuation contributions to the nominated complying fund. worker in relation to any period in respect of which—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/2/a.content: the worker's employer makes contributions for the benefit of the worker to any scheme or fund for the payment of superannuation, retirement benefits or death benefits (other than under a salary sacrifice agreement or arrangement); and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/2/b.content: those contributions— (i) exceed the contributions (if any) necessary for the employer to avoid an individual superannuation guarantee shortfall under the Superannuation Act in respect of a worker; and (ii) are made for the purpose of discharging an obligation of the employer to the worker that arises because of the worker's injury under any public sector superannuation scheme, agreement or arrangement or any law of the Commonwealth or a State or Territory relating to superannuation or an industrial award.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/3.content: The amount that the Authority or self-insurer is liable to pay, subject to and in accordance with this section, as compensation in the form of superannuation contributions for the benefit of a worker is the amount equal to the charge percentage of the compensation in the form of weekly payments payable to the worker under this Part after the expiry of the period referred to in subsection (1)(b)(i) other than—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/a.content: compensation under section 93CA, unless Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 121 the worker is receiving compensation under section 93CD; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/4.content: Subject to subsection (1), the Authority or self-insurer must, within 28 days after becoming aware that it is liable to pay to a worker compensation in the form of superannuation contributions subject to and in accordance with this section, notify the worker in writing—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/4/a.content: that the Authority or self-insurer is so liable and of the date on which it became so liable; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/4/b.content: of the amount of its liability, expressed as the charge percentage of the weekly amount that the worker receives as compensation in the form of weekly payments in respect of the injury; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/4/c.content: that the Authority or self-insurer is required to pay the contributions to a complying fund nominated by the worker; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/4/d.content: that the worker is required to nominate a complying fund to the Authority or self-insurer; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/4/e.content: that contributions cannot be paid to the nominated complying fund unless the worker, or the worker's employer on behalf of the worker, has provided details of the worker's tax file number to the trustee of the nominated complying fund; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/4/f.content: that the worker is entitled to nominate a different complying fund, but not more than once in any period of 12 months; and amended by No. 80/2010 s. 56(a).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/g.content: that, if the worker does not nominate a Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 122 complying fund, or does not provide sufficient details to enable contributions to be paid to a complying fund, within 3 months after the date on which the notice under this subsection is given to the worker, the Authority or self-insurer is not liable to pay compensation in the form of superannuation contributions in respect of any period before it receives those details.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/5.content: Subject to subsection (1), payment under this section must be made to the worker's nominated complying fund—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/5/a.content: in the case of the Authority, within— (i) 30 days after it is informed by the worker's employer that compensation in the form of weekly payments has been paid; or (ii) 120 days after compensation in the form of weekly payments has been paid— whichever first occurs;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/5/b.content: in the case of a self-insurer, at least quarterly.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/6.content: Despite anything to the contrary in section 125A(2), the Authority is liable to pay compensation in the form of superannuation contributions in accordance with this section.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/7.content: Where the liability of the Authority under this section is discharged, the discharge is to be treated as if a liability of the employer is discharged. amended by No. 80/2010 s. 56(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/8.content: In this section— Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 123 charge percentage means the percentage applicable for the time being under section 19(2) of the Superannuation Act; complying fund means a complying superannuation fund or scheme within the meaning of section 7 of the Superannuation Act but does not include—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/8/a.content: a defined benefit superannuation scheme within the meaning of section 6A(1) of that Act; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93CE/8/b.content: a scheme that is a defined benefit superannuation scheme because of section 6A(2) of that Act; Superannuation Act means the Superannuation Guarantee (Administration) Act 1992 of the Commonwealth.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93E.title: Injury after retirement
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93E.content:
If a worker is injured within the period of 
130 weeks before attaining retirement age or after 
attaining retirement age, the worker is entitled to 
weekly payments under this Part for not more than 
the first 130 weeks (whether consecutive or not) 
of incapacity for work.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA.title: Compensation for incapacity arising after
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA.content:
Accident Compensation Act 1985 
No. 10191 of 1985 
125   
 (d) the worker has not previously received 
payment of compensation in respect of the 
injury under this section. 
 (5) An application under subsection (2) must— 
 (a) specify the reason for the application; and 
 (b) be provided with supporting evidence. 
 (6) Within 28 days of receiving the application, the 
Authority or self-insurer must— 
 (a) approve or reject the application; and 
 (b) give the worker written notice of its decision, 
including in the case of rejection, a statement 
of the reasons for the decision.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/1.content: This section applies to a worker, not being a retirement age worker to whom section 93E applies, if the worker—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/1/a.content: before retirement age— (i) suffered an injury arising out of or in the course of employment; and inserted by No. 64/1989 s. 10, substituted by No. 67/1992 s. 15, amended by Nos 107/1997 s. 31, 102/2004 s. 23, 41/2006 s. 5(5). inserted by No. 41/2006 s. 14.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/b.content: received a weekly payment of compensation Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 124 (ii) made a claim for compensation in respect of that injury under section 103; and in respect of that injury within the period of 10 years before the worker attained retirement age; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/c.content: after retirement age, became incapacitated for work and the incapacity is a consequence of treatment received after retirement age as an inpatient at a hospital for that injury; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/d.content: the worker has not previously received Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 125 payment of compensation in respect of the injury under this section.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/2.content: If this section applies to a worker, the worker may apply in writing to the Authority or self-insurer for weekly payments in respect of the incapacity payable at the rate specified in section 93B(2)(a) or (b) or 93B(3)(a) or (b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/3.content: The maximum period of weekly payments payable under this section is 13 weeks.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/4.content: A worker who makes an application in accordance with subsection (2) is entitled to receive weekly payments under this section if—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/4/a.content: the worker was a worker at the time the incapacity arose; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/4/b.content: the incapacity is in respect of the work that the worker was performing immediately before the incapacity arose; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/4/c.content: the worker has not ceased to become entitled to weekly payments due to the application of this Part or Part VIIB or section 119J(1) or (3), 134AB(36) or 135A(18); and amended by No. 9/2010 s. 32(b) (as amended by No. 80/2010 s. 159(e)). substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 32(c) (as amended by No. 80/2010 s. 159(f)).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/5/a.content: specify the reason for the application; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/6.content: Within 28 days of receiving the application, the Authority or self-insurer must—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/6/a.content: approve or reject the application; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93EA/6/b.content: give the worker written notice of its decision, including in the case of rejection, a statement of the reasons for the decision.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93F.title: Compensation after retirement
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s93F.content:
Subject to sections 93E and 93EA, a worker is not 
entitled to weekly payments under this Part after 
attaining retirement age.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/2/b.content: withdraws or redeems any part of, or withdraws or redeems any interest, or part of any interest on, such a superannuation or retirement benefit lump sum that has been deposited with a complying superannuation fund or a complying approved deposit fund— the worker is not entitled to weekly payments under this Part during the specified period after the date on which he or she received the lump sum or made the withdrawal or redemption, as the case requires, or became eligible to receive weekly payments, whichever is the later. amended by No. 9/2010 s. 40(2)(a). repealed by No. 9/2010 s. 40(2)(b). substituted by No. 7/1996 s. 18, amended by Nos 7/1996 s. 19(1), 60/1996 s. 13(2), 9/2010 s. 40(2)(c), substituted by No. 80/2010 s. 57.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/3.content: The specified period for the purposes of Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 127 subsection (2) is the number of weeks determined by dividing the amount received, withdrawn or redeemed by the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings as varied in accordance with Division 2D of Part IV.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/4.content: If a worker withdraws or redeems any part of the amount deposited or used under subsection (2) which represents the worker's own contributions for the purpose of an approved capital expenditure within the meaning of subsection (5), subsection (2) does not apply in respect of that withdrawal or redemption.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/5.content: For the purposes of subsection (4) approved capital expenditure means capital expenditure approved by the Authority or by a self-insurer in accordance with guidelines issued by the Authority.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/6.content: The amount of compensation in the form of weekly payments payable to a worker under this Part must be reduced by the amount (if any) by which the sum of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/6/b.content: the weekly rate of any disability pension received by or for the benefit of the worker and which relates to an injury in respect of which compensation in the form of weekly payments is payable to the worker; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/6/c.content: the worker's current weekly earnings— exceeds the supplemental pension limit. substituted by Nos 7/1996 s. 18, 80/2010 s. 57. inserted by No. 7/1996 s. 19(2). inserted by No. 7/1996 s. 19(2), amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(d). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 40(3).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/7.content: In this section— Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 128 disability pension, in relation to a worker, means an amount payable under an insurance policy or by a trustee acting in the capacity of a trustee that—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/7/a.content: relates to an injury in respect of which compensation in the form of weekly payments is payable under this Part; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s96/7/b.content: is payable in the form of periodic payments to or for the benefit of the worker— but does not include a retirement or superannuation pension; supplemental pension limit, in relation to a worker, means the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings as calculated under section 5A as indexed in accordance with section 100(1) and calculated as if the period of 52 weeks referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition of enhancement period in section 5AD had not expired.
