/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/8/d.content: be served by post on all the parties to the dispute.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/9.content: The Authority or self-insurer must within 14 days after the certificate has been served on the Authority or self-insurer make a statutory offer in writing in settlement or compromise of the claim. amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(a). amended by Nos 107/1997 s. 35(2), 81/1998 s. 23(a).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/10.content: If any medical question has been referred by the Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 199 Conciliation Officer under section 56(6) for an opinion by a Medical Panel, the statutory offer must be consistent with that opinion.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/11.content: If the Authority or self-insurer fails to comply with subsection (9), the Authority or self-insurer is deemed to have made a statutory offer of nothing. (11A) The claimant must within 21 days after the making by the Authority or self-insurer of a statutory offer—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/11/a.content: has not accepted the statutory offer; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/11/b.content: has not made a counter statutory offer— the claimant is deemed to have made a counter statutory offer of an amount equal to the total of the maximum amounts that can be claimed for the relevant injury or injuries under section 98 and, where applicable, under section 98A.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/12.content: A party to any proceedings relating to a claim for compensation under section 98 or 98A cannot in evidence submit any medical evidence or tender a medical report or adduce evidence dependent on a medical report unless that evidence is disclosed by a medical report a copy of which has been provided to the other party in accordance with subsection (1) or (2) or a copy of which has been provided in accordance with subsection (8).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/13.content: Subsection (12) does not affect the admissibility of the opinion of the Medical Panel. amended by No. 107/1997 s. 35(2). amended by Nos 107/1997 s. 35(2), 81/1998 s. 23(a). inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 35(3), amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(a). inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 35(3).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/14.content: For the purposes of this section if a medical report Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 200 was oral, a copy of the medical report is to be taken to have been provided to the other party in accordance with subsection (1) or (2) if notice in writing of the substance of the medical report is provided to the other party in accordance with subsection (1) or (2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/15/a.content: means a statement on medical matters concerning the worker whether in writing or oral made by a medical practitioner; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/15/b.content: includes any document which the medical practitioner intends should be read with a statement whether the document was in existence at the time the statement was made or was a document which he or she obtained or caused to be brought into existence subsequently. 104AA Withdrawal of claims for compensation under sections 98 and 98A

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104/4/b.content: the Medical Panel has given its opinion on the question— that opinion has effect for the purposes of any subsequent claim for compensation under section 98 or 98A made by the worker in respect of which the opinion is relevant as if the opinion had been obtained for the purposes of that subsequent claim.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104A.title: Directions relating to claim for compensation under
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104A.content:
Accident Compensation Act 1985 
No. 10191 of 1985 
202   
 (3) The directions apply to claims for compensation 
under sections 98 and 98A given, served or lodged 
after the publication of the directions. 
 (4) The parties to a claim and their legal practitioners 
and agents must comply with the directions. 
 (5) Directions made under subsection (1) may specify 
that the failure to comply with a particular 
provision of the directions has the effect of 
suspending the claim or any proceeding relating to 
the claim until the provision is complied with. 
 (6) Directions made under subsection (1)— 
 (a) may require that each of the parties to a 
claim or their legal representatives provide 
information by affidavit to the other parties 
or their legal representatives and, if 
applicable, to a Conciliation Officer; and 
 (b) may require that the parties to a claim and 
their legal representatives must attend at a 
conference or conferences in respect of the 
claim.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104A/1.content: For the purposes of section 104, the Minister may sections 98 and 98A issue directions for or with respect to procedures for the determination of claims for compensation under sections 98 and 98A. (1A) For the purposes of section 104AA, the Minister may issue directions for or with respect to procedures for the withdrawal of claims of compensation under sections 98 and 98A. * * * * * inserted by No. 7/1996 s. 24(1). amended by No. 60/1996 s. 20. inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 19(1). amended by No. 82/2001 s. 19(2), repealed by No. 80/2010 s. 122(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104A/3.content: The directions apply to claims for compensation Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 202 under sections 98 and 98A given, served or lodged after the publication of the directions.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104A/4.content: The parties to a claim and their legal practitioners and agents must comply with the directions.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104A/5.content: Directions made under subsection (1) may specify that the failure to comply with a particular provision of the directions has the effect of suspending the claim or any proceeding relating to the claim until the provision is complied with.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104A/6/a.content: may require that each of the parties to a claim or their legal representatives provide information by affidavit to the other parties or their legal representatives and, if applicable, to a Conciliation Officer; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104A/6/b.content: may require that the parties to a claim and their legal representatives must attend at a conference or conferences in respect of the claim.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B.title: Claims for compensation under section 98C
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B.content:
Accident Compensation Act 1985 
No. 10191 of 1985 
220   
 (b) advised the Authority or self-insurer under 
subsection (7B) or (10A) that he or she 
wishes to receive the compensation to which 
he or she is entitled. 
 * * * * *

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/1.content: In addition to the requirements under section 103, this section, and section 6(1) and Divisions 1 and 2 of Part 2 of the Workplace Injury Rehabilitation and Compensation Act 2013 apply to a claim for compensation under section 98C. amended by No. 107/1997 s. 35(4). amended by No. 82/2001 s. 19(3). inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 35(5), amended by No. 82/2001 s. 19(3). inserted by No. 107/1997 s. 43(2). amended by No. 67/2013 s. 635(1) (as amended by No. 44/2014 s. 24(30)).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/a.content: if the entitlement is under section 98C, make Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 215 (10B) Subject to section 134AB(36), the Authority or self-insurer must, within 14 days of being advised by the worker either under subsection (10A) or at a later date that the worker accepts the entitlement to compensation— payments in accordance with section 98D; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/b.content: advised the Authority or self-insurer under Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 220 subsection (7B) or (10A) that he or she wishes to receive the compensation to which he or she is entitled. * * * * *

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/2.content: The Authority or self-insurer must within 120 days of receiving a claim made by the worker or in the case of a claim initiated by the Authority or self-insurer, within 120 days of the relevant date—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/2/a.content: if the claim is a claim made by the worker, accept or reject liability for each injury included in the claim;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/2/b.content: obtain an assessment or assessments in accordance with section 91 as to the degree of permanent impairment (if any) of the worker resulting from the injury or injuries in respect of which liability is accepted;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/2/c.content: after taking into account the assessment or assessments obtained under paragraph (b), determine the degree of permanent impairment (if any) of the worker for each of the purposes of— inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(1). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(a), substituted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(2), amended by No. 41/2006 s. 19(4)(a). amended by No. 41/2006 s. 19(4)(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/d.content: as if in subsection (10) as then in force "and of the consequences as specified in subsection (11A) of confirming in writing that he or she wishes to receive any compensation to which he or she is entitled" were omitted;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/e.content: as if in subsection (10A) as then in force, for "wishes to receive the compensation to which he or she is entitled" there were substituted "accepts or disputes the entitlement to compensation";

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/f.content: as if in subsection (10B) as then in force, for "wishes to receive the compensation to which he or she is entitled" there were substituted "accepts the entitlement to compensation";

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/g.content: as if subsection (11A) as then in force were repealed.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/c.content: as if in subsection (8) as then in force, for "wishes to receive the compensation to which he or she is entitled" there were substituted "accepts the entitlement";

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/3.content: If the Authority or self-insurer rejects liability Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 207 (2A) The Authority or self-insurer is not bound by the assessment or assessments obtained under subsection (2)(b) in determining the degree of permanent impairment (if any) under subsection (2)(c). in relation to the injuries included in the claim made by the worker and the worker disputes the decision as to liability, the worker must not commence proceedings in relation to the claim made by the worker unless the worker first refers the dispute for conciliation by a Conciliation Officer in accordance with Division 2 of Part III and until the Conciliation Officer has issued a certificate under section 49.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/4.content: The worker must at the request of the Authority or self-insurer attend an independent examination to be conducted by a medical practitioner referred to in section 91(1)(b) for the purposes this section.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/5.content: The Authority or self-insurer must obtain assessments in accordance with section 91 as to the degree of permanent impairment resulting from any injury for which liability is accepted or established for the purposes of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/5/a.content: determining any entitlement of the worker to compensation under section 98C;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/5/b.content: determining the whole person impairment under sections 134AB(3) and 134AB(15);

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/5/c.content: Subdivision 1 of Division 3A. inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(2). amended by Nos 81/1998 s. 23(a), 102/2004 s. 5(3), 41/2006 s. 19(6). amended by Nos 107/1997 s. 25(3), 81/1998 s. 23(a), substituted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(4). amended by Nos 26/2000 s. 16(2), 82/2001 s. 6(a), substituted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(5).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/6.content: The worker must within 60 days of being advised Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 210 (5F) If the worker was not 18 years of age at the time of the event or circumstance, the determination of impairment resulting from the injury can not be made until the worker attains the age of 18 years. under subsection (2) in respect of a claim made by the worker advise the Authority or self-insurer in writing whether the worker accepts or disputes the decision as to liability in respect of each of the injuries claimed. (6A) If under subsection (6) a worker disputes any part of the decision as to liability, the worker does not have to respond to any other part of the advice under subsection (2). (6B) Subject to subsection (6), the worker must within 60 days of being advised under subsection (2) advise the Authority or self-insurer in writing—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/6/a.content: whether the worker accepts or disputes the determinations of impairment and total loss;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/6/b.content: if the worker accepts the determinations of impairment and total loss, whether the worker accepts or disputes the entitlement to compensation, if any. * * * * * inserted by No. 26/2000 s. 16(3), amended by No. 102/2004 s. 5(7)(b)(i)(ii). amended by Nos 81/1998 s. 23(a), 26/2000 ss 16(4)(a), s. 17(1), 82/2001 s. 20(1), substituted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(8), amended by No. 41/2006 s. 19(12). inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(8). inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(8) , amended by No. 41/2006 s. 19(13). amended by No. 41/2006 s. 18(2)(a). repealed by No. 41/2006 s. 18(2)(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/7.content: If the decision made under subsection (2)(a) to Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 211 reject liability for an injury is varied as the result of a decision of a court or an agreement between the worker and the Authority or self-insurer, the Authority or self-insurer must within 90 days of the variation—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/7/a.content: obtain an assessment or assessments in accordance with section 91 as to the degree of permanent impairment (if any) of the worker resulting from the injury or injuries in respect of which liability is accepted or determined;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/7/b.content: after taking into account the assessment or assessments obtained under paragraph (a), determine the degree of permanent impairment (if any) of the worker for each of the purposes of— (i) section 98C; (ii) section 134AB; (iii) Subdivision 1 of Division 3A;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/7/c.content: determine whether the worker has an injury which is a total loss mentioned in the Table in Schedule 3B;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/7/d.content: calculate any entitlement to compensation under section 98C or 98E;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/7/e.content: advise the worker as to— (i) the decision or determination of liability for each injury included in the claim; amended by Nos 81/1998 s. 23(a), 26/2000 ss 16(4)(b), s. 17(2), 82/2001 s. 20(1), substituted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(8). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 62(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/8.content: Subject to section 134AB(36), the Authority or self-insurer must, within 14 days of being advised by the worker either under subsection (6B) or (7B) or at a later date that the worker accepts the determinations of impairment and total loss and the entitlement to compensation—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/8/a.content: if the entitlement is under section 98C, make payments in accordance with section 98D; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/8/b.content: if the entitlement is under section 98E, pay the amount specified for the total loss under section 98E.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/9.content: The Authority or self-insurer must, within 14 days of being advised by the worker that the worker disputes the determinations of impairment or total loss in respect of the injury or injuries claimed, refer the medical questions as to—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/9/a.content: the degree of impairment assessed in accordance with section 91 resulting from the injury or injuries claimed for which liability is accepted or established; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/9/b.content: whether the worker has an injury or injuries claimed for which liability is accepted or established which is a total loss mentioned in the Table in Schedule 3B— to a Medical Panel for its opinion under section 67. amended by No. 41/2006 s. 18(3)(a). repealed by No. 41/2006 s. 18(3)(b). amended by Nos 81/1998 s. 23(a), 26/2000 s. 16(4)(c), substituted by No. 26/2000 s. 17(3), amended by No. 102/2004 s. 5(9)(a)(b), substituted by No. 41/2006 s. 18(4). amended by Nos 81/1998 s. 23(a), 26/2000 s. 16(4)(d)(i)(ii), 82/2001 s. 6(b), substituted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(10). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 62(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/10.content: The Authority or self-insurer must, within 60 days of obtaining the opinion of the Medical Panel under section 67, advise the worker of the opinion and the entitlement, if any, under section 98C or 98E. (10A) The worker must, within 60 days of being advised by the Authority or self-insurer of the entitlement of the worker to compensation in accordance with subsection (10), advise the Authority or self-insurer whether the worker accepts or disputes the entitlement to compensation. inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(10). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(a), substituted by No. 26/2000 s. 17(4), amended by No. 82/2001 s. 20(1), substituted by No. 41/2006 s. 18(5). inserted by No. 26/2000 s. 17(4), substituted by No. 41/2006 s. 18(5).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/11.content: For the purposes of this section, liability in relation to a claim does not include a question as to the degree of permanent impairment of a worker or whether a worker has an injury which is a total loss mentioned in the Table in Schedule 3B. * * * * *

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/12.content: No appeal lies to any court or Tribunal from a determination or opinion—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/12/a.content: as to the degree of permanent impairment of a worker resulting from an injury; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/12/b.content: as to whether a worker has an injury which is a total loss mentioned in the Table in Schedule 3B.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/13.content: For the purposes of this section, the Minister may issue directions for or with respect to procedures for the determination of claims for compensation under section 98C, including directions requiring that information in classes of claims specified in the directions must be provided by affidavit. inserted by No. 26/2000 s. 17(4), substituted by No. 41/2006 s. 18(5). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 62(b). inserted by No. 26/2000 s. 17(5) , repealed by No. 41/2006 s. 18(6). amended by No. 102/2004 s. 5(11). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 62(b). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 122(3).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/14.content: This section as amended by section 16 of the Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 216 Accident Compensation (Common Law and Benefits) Act 2000 applies in respect of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/14/a.content: all claims for compensation under section 98C given, served or lodged on or after the commencement of section 16 of the Accident Compensation (Common Law and Benefits) Act 2000;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/14/b.content: an assessment for the purposes of sections 134AB(3) and 134AB(15) in respect of an injury to a worker on or after 20 October 1999 whose claim for compensation under section 98C was given, served or lodged before the commencement of section 16 of the Accident Compensation (Common Law and Benefits) Act 2000;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/15.content: If a worker has given, served or lodged a claim for compensation under section 98C before the commencement of section 16 of the Accident Compensation (Common Law and Benefits) Act 2000 and on or after that commencement claims compensation under section 98C for any other injury which arose from the same event or circumstance in respect of which the injury the subject of the previous claim arose, this section as amended by section 16 of the Accident Compensation (Common Law and Benefits) Act 2000 applies in respect of the subsequent claim.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/16.content: Subject to subsection (14), this section as in force before the commencement of section 16 of the Accident Compensation (Common Law and Benefits) Act 2000 continues to apply in respect of all claims for compensation under section 98C given, served or lodged before the commencement inserted by No. 26/2000 s. 16(5). inserted by No. 26/2000 s. 16(5). inserted by No. 26/2000 s. 16(5).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/17.content: This section as amended by section 17 of the Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 217 of section 16 of the Accident Compensation (Common Law and Benefits) Act 2000. Accident Compensation (Common Law and Benefits) Act 2000 applies in respect of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/17/a.content: all claims for compensation under section 98C given, served or lodged on or after the commencement of section 17 of the Accident Compensation (Common Law and Benefits) Act 2000;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/17/b.content: a request made under subsection (1C) on or after that commencement;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/17/c.content: an assessment on or after that commencement for the purposes of sections 134AB(3) and 134AB(15) in respect of an injury to a worker on or after 20 October 1999.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/18.content: This section as amended by section 20 of the Accident Compensation (Amendment) Act 2001 only applies—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/18/a.content: in the case of subsection (6), to any case in which the Authority or self-insurer obtained the assessments and determination on or after the date of commencement of section 20 of that Act;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/18/b.content: in the case of subsection (7), to any case in which the worker was advised under subsection (6) on or after the date of commencement of section 20 of that Act;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/18/c.content: in the case of subsection (10), to any case in which the Authority or self-insurer obtained the opinion of the Medical Panel under section 67 on or after the date of commencement of section 20 of that Act. inserted by No. 26/2000 s. 17(6). inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 20(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/19.content: If as at the commencement of section 5 of Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 218 the Accident Compensation Legislation (Amendment) Act 2004 a worker has attended at least 1 impairment examination, the assessment of impairment and the final determination of the claim of the worker must be completed in accordance with this section as in force before that commencement.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/20.content: If as at the commencement of section 5 of the Accident Compensation Legislation (Amendment) Act 2004 a worker has lodged an impairment claim but has not attended any impairment examinations, the worker may before attending an impairment examination elect by notice in writing to the Authority or self-insurer—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/20/a.content: to continue to have the claim determined in accordance with this section as in force before that commencement; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/21.content: If a worker withdraws a claim under subsection (20)(b), the worker may submit a new claim as if it were the first claim of that type that the worker was submitting in respect of that injury.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/22.content: This section as in force before the commencement of section 5 of the Accident Compensation Legislation (Amendment) Act 2004 applies to a worker to whom subsection (19) or (20)(a) applies with the following modifications—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/22/a.content: as if in subsection (6) as then in force "and of the consequences as specified in subsection (11A) of confirming in writing that he or she wishes to receive any compensation to which he or she is entitled" were omitted; inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(12). inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(12). inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 5(12). inserted by No. 41/2006 s. 18(7).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/23.content: Subject to subsection (22), this section as amended by section 18 of the Accident Compensation and Other Legislation (Amendment) Act 2006 applies to an impairment claim whether lodged before, on or after 18 November 2004 unless the worker has before 1 June 2006—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s104B/23/a.content: made an application under section 134AB(4); or inserted by No. 41/2006 s. 18(7).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s106.title: Lodging of claims with Authority in certain

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s106/1.content: If a person making a claim for compensation circumstances becomes aware that the employer—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s106/1/d.content: is a corporation that has been wound up; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s106/1/e.content: has not complied or is not likely to comply with section 108; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s106/1/f.content: is refusing to receive the claim— that person must lodge the claim with the Authority.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s106/2.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to a claim in respect of an injury arising wholly out of or in the course of or due to the nature of employment on or after 4 p.m. on 30 June 1993. substituted by No. 50/1994 s. 50, amended by Nos 107/1997 s. 30(9), 81/1998 s. 23(a), 9/2010 s. 20, repealed by No. 67/2013 s. 635(2). substituted by No. 50/1994 s. 50. amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(g).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s110.title: Application by worker to alter amount of weekly

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s110/1.content: A worker who is receiving weekly payments may payments apply in writing to the Authority or self-insurer for an increase or reduction in the amount of the payments and must specify in the application the reasons for so applying and provide with the application any supporting evidence.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s110/2.content: Within 28 days after receiving an application, the Authority or self-insurer must—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s110/2/a.content: approve or reject the application; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s110/2/b.content: give the worker and the employer written notice of its decision, including, in the case of rejection, a statement of the reasons for the decision. * * * * * substituted by No. 50/1994 s. 50. amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o). substituted by No. 50/1994 s. 50, amended by Nos 63/1996 s. 98(Sch. item 1.2), 107/1997 s. 30(10), 81/1998 s. 23(o), 28/2005 s. 22, repealed by No. 67/2013 s. 635(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114.title: Termination or alteration of weekly payments
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114.content:
Accident Compensation Act 1985 
No. 10191 of 1985 
232   
unless the Authority or self-insurer gives a notice 
in writing in accordance with subsection (3) to the 
worker— 
 (a) stating the reasons for the termination; and 
 (b) stating when the payments will cease. 
 (3) A notice in writing under subsection (2) must be 
given— 
 (a) if compensation in the form of 
superannuation contributions has been paid 
in respect of a worker for a continuous 
period of at least 12 weeks and not more than 
1 year—at least 14 days before the 
termination; 
 (b) if compensation in the form of 
superannuation contributions has been paid 
in respect of the worker for a continuous 
period of 1 year or more—at least 28 days 
before the termination.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/1.content: Subject to this section, the Authority or a self-insurer may terminate the payment of compensation in the form of superannuation contributions in respect of a worker on the ground that the worker—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/2.content: The Authority or self-insurer must not terminate payments in the form of superannuation contributions (otherwise than because the worker is not, or has ceased to be, entitled to compensation in the form of weekly payments) inserted by No. 41/2006 s. 20(b), amended by No. 9/2010 ss 33(1)(b), 45(5)(a). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 45(5)(b). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 45(5)(b). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 46 (as amended by No. 80/2010 s. 159(i)).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/2/a.content: may increase or reduce weekly payments on the ground that there is not, or is no longer, an entitlement to weekly payments of the existing amount; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/2/b.content: may terminate weekly payments on the ground that— (i) the worker is not entitled to compensation under Division 1 or 2; or (ii) the worker is not, or is no longer entitled to weekly payments; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/2/c.content: may terminate or alter weekly payments on the ground that— (i) the worker has returned to any work whether as a self employed person or in employment; or (ii) in the case of a worker who has current weekly earnings, the amount of the worker's current weekly earnings alters; or (iii) payments for regular overtime or shift allowances are no longer included in the worker's pre-injury average weekly earnings; or (iv) an amount referred to in section 155(1)(c) of the Workplace Injury Rehabilitation and Compensation Act 2013 is varied or no longer paid; or amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o). amended by No. 26/2000 s. 4(3), substituted by No. 9/2010 s. 45(1). inserted by No. 26/2000 s. 4(3), amended by No. 67/2013 s. 635(3). inserted by No. 67/2013 s. 635(4).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/a.content: stating the reasons for the termination; and Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 232 unless the Authority or self-insurer gives a notice in writing in accordance with subsection (3) to the worker—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/b.content: stating when the payments will cease.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/c.content: if the termination of weekly payments is Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 231 solely on the ground of the expiry of the second entitlement period—13 weeks; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/d.content: if the worker has been receiving compensation in the form of weekly payments under section 93CD and ceases to be entitled to receive such compensation— 28 days; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/e.content: if the worker has been receiving compensation in the form of weekly payments under section 93CD and the termination is because the employer has withdrawn the employment—13 weeks commencing on the day on which the employer informs the worker of the withdrawal of employment. 114AA Termination of compensation in the form of superannuation contributions

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/f.content: not to alter the amount of compensation in the form of weekly payments paid to the worker; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/g.content: not to pay compensation in the form of weekly payments. inserted by No. 67/2013 s. 635(4). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 45(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/3.content: A notice in writing under subsection (2) must be given—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/4.content: A termination or alteration of weekly payments on the grounds specified in subsection (2)(a) or (2)(b) has effect—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/4/a.content: only if written notice in accordance with subsection (10) is given; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/4/b.content: after the expiry of the required notice period.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/5.content: A termination or alteration of weekly payments on the grounds specified in subsection (2)(c) or section 93E, 93F, 96, 97(2), 97(7), 134AB(36) or 135A(18) has effect—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/5/a.content: without the giving of notice; and inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 45(2). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 45(2). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 45(3). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o). amended by No. 80/2010 s. 67.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/6.content: A termination of weekly payments on the ground specified in subsection (3) has effect—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/6/a.content: if written notice in accordance with subsection (10) is given; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/6/b.content: as from the day (whether before, on or after the giving of the notice) on which the Authority or self-insurer makes the decision. * * * * *

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/8.content: A reduction of weekly payments solely on the ground of the expiry of the first entitlement period has effect—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/8/a.content: if written notice in accordance with subsection (10) is given; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/8/b.content: if section 114A has been complied with.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/9.content: A termination of weekly payments solely on the ground of the expiry of the second entitlement period19 has effect—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/9/a.content: if written notice in accordance with subsection (10) is given; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/9/b.content: if section 114B has been complied with. inserted by No. 41/2006 s. 15(3). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(a). amended by No. 107/1997 s. 30(11)(a), repealed by No. 9/2010 s. 130(3)(b). amended by Nos 107/1997 s. 30(11)(b), 9/2010 s. 33(1)(a). amended by Nos 7/1996 s. 16(3), 107/1997 s. 30(11)(c), 9/2010 s. 33(1)(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/10/a.content: be given to the worker; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/10/b.content: state the reasons for giving the notice; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/10/c.content: state— (i) in the case of termination, when weekly payments will be stopped; and (ii) in the case of alteration, the new level of weekly payments and when payments at the new level will commence.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/11/a.content: has received weekly payments of compensation for a continuous period of at least 12 weeks; and inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 45(4). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/12.content: If weekly payments are terminated or reduced in contravention of subsection (11), the worker may recover from the Authority or self-insurer an amount of compensation that—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/12/a.content: if no period of notice has been given— is equal to the amount of compensation or additional compensation, that would have been payable during the required period of notice if weekly payments had not been terminated or reduced; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/12/b.content: if less than the required period of notice has been given—is equal to the amount of compensation that would have been payable during the balance of the required period of notice if weekly payments had not been terminated or reduced.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/13.content: The required period of notice, unless expressly otherwise provided in this Act is—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/13/a.content: if the worker has been receiving weekly payments of compensation for a continuous period of at least 12 weeks but less than 1 year—14 days; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/13/b.content: if the worker has been receiving weekly payments of compensation for a continuous period of 1 year or more—28 days; or amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o). amended by No. 9/2010 s. 130(3)(a). amended by No. 41/2006 s. 20(a).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/1/a.content: is not, or has ceased to be, entitled to such compensation; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/1/b.content: is not, or has ceased to be, entitled to compensation in the form of weekly payments.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/3/a.content: if compensation in the form of superannuation contributions has been paid in respect of a worker for a continuous period of at least 12 weeks and not more than 1 year—at least 14 days before the termination;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114/3/b.content: if compensation in the form of superannuation contributions has been paid in respect of the worker for a continuous period of 1 year or more—at least 28 days before the termination.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114A/3.content: Despite anything to the contrary in section 93B, until notice is given to a worker and the date specified in the notice has expired, the worker is deemed to be entitled to weekly payments in respect of any period after the expiry of the first entitlement period under section 93B(2)(a) or (3)(a) provided that the worker is but for the expiry of 13 weeks otherwise entitled to weekly payments. * * * * *

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114C/1.content: If a Conciliation Officer directs, or the Magistrates' Court or the County Court determines, that weekly payments are payable by the Authority or a self-insurer, the Authority or self-insurer must commence payment, including amounts payable under section 114E, no later than 7 days after the direction or determination.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114C/2.content: On the commencement of payment under subsection (1), the Authority or self-insurer must pay an amount equal to any outstanding weekly payments to the worker.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114C/3.content: If the Authority, a self-insurer or an employer accepts a claim for weekly payments, payments including amounts payable under section 114E must commence to be paid within 7 days after the claim is accepted.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114C/4.content: If a Conciliation Officer directs or the Magistrates' Court or the County Court determines, that weekly payments be made, section 114E applies and the entitlement of the worker to weekly payments commences on the date specified by the Conciliation Officer or by the Magistrates' Court or the County Court. inserted by No. 50/1994 s. 50. amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o), substituted by No. 80/2010 s. 68. amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(o).

self-insurer except in relation to the employment

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/1.content: If a worker is entitled to weekly payments, the Authority unless the Authority determines otherwise, must make the payments to the worker's employer.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/2/a.content: to which a direction or determination under section 114C(1) to pay weekly payments applies, must commence payment within 7 days after the direction or determination is made; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/2/b.content: which accepts a claim under section 114C(3) to make weekly payments to a worker and there are any outstanding payments of weekly payments, must pay those outstanding weekly payments to the worker within 7 days after accepting the claim. Penalty: 300 penalty units. inserted by No. 50/1994 s. 50. amended by Nos 47/1996 s. 17(a), 81/1998 s. 23(p). amended by Nos 47/1996 s. 17(b), 81/1998 s. 23(q), 9/2010 s. 160, substituted by No. 67/2013 s. 635(5). inserted by No. 67/2013 s. 635(5).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/3.content: If an employer is required to make a payment of Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 238 weekly payments before the employer receives the payment from the Authority, the employer must be reimbursed by the Authority.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/4.content: If an employer to whom subsection (3) applies does not apply within 3 months after making the payment of weekly payments to a worker for reimbursement by the Authority, the Authority is not required to reimburse the employer but may do so if satisfied that the employer's delay in making the application was reasonable.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/5.content: If the Authority does not reimburse the employer in respect of a payment referred to in subsection (3) within the prescribed period, the Authority is liable to pay the employer interest at the prescribed rate on the amount of the payment until the Authority reimburses the employer in respect of the payment.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/6.content: A weekly payment must be made to a worker—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/6/a.content: before the expiry of 7 days after the end of the week in respect of which it is payable; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/6/b.content: if the worker would be paid less frequently if the worker were at work, at such time or at such intervals as he or she would be paid if at work. * * * * *

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/9.content: The liability to a worker is not satisfied until the worker receives the weekly payment. amended by Nos 47/1996 s. 17(b), 81/1998 s. 23(q). amended by Nos 7/1996 s. 28, 81/1998 s. 23(q). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(q). repealed by No. 67/2013 s. 635(6).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114D/10.content: In subsections (1) to (5) employer means a Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 239 person who is or has been an employer of the worker and whom the Authority determines to be the employer for the purposes of this section but does not include a self-insurer or a subsidiary of a self-insurer except in relation to the employment of a student worker.

114EB Alteration or termination of superannuation 
contributions 
The Authority or a self-insurer is not required to 
give written notice to the worker of— 
 (a) an alteration of compensation in the form of

of superannuation contributions where the 
termination is because the worker is not, or 
has ceased to be, entitled to compensation in 
the form of weekly payments.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114E/1.content: Subject to subsection (2), outstanding payments of compensation in the form of superannuation contributions under section 93CE, and interest at the prescribed rate on each outstanding payment from the last date on which such a payment should have been paid until the date on which the payment is paid, are payable to the superannuation fund nominated by the worker under section 93CE for the benefit of the worker if a decision to terminate superannuation contributions under section 114AA is set aside by the court.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114E/1/b.content: subject to subsection (1A), if a decision to reject a claim for weekly payments is set aside by the Magistrates' Court or the County Court, from the day on which the incapacity amended by Nos 47/1996 s. 17(c)(i)(ii), 81/1998 s. 23(q). inserted by No. 50/1994 s. 50. amended by No. 41/2006 s. 22(1). /au-victoria/aca/1985/s114E/d.content: subject to subsection (1A), if a decision to reject an application by a worker to increase the amount of weekly payments is set aside by the Magistrates' Court or the County Court, from a day determined by the Magistrates' Court or the County Court until the day on which the decision is set aside;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114E/e.content: if an employer, the Authority or a self-insurer fails to make any weekly payment as and when required by the Act to be made to a worker, from the day after the payment was required to be made until the day before the payment is made. (1A) If a worker has not made an application to the Magistrates' Court or the County Court within one year of being notified by a Conciliation Officer under section 59(4) that the Conciliation Officer is satisfied that there is a genuine dispute with respect to the liability to make or continue to make weekly payments and that an application may be made to the Magistrates' Court or the County Court to determine the matter, interest is not payable under subsection (1) in respect of the period beginning after the expiry of one year after that date and ending on the day on which the application is made. amended by No. 41/2006 s. 22(2). amended by No. 41/2006 s. 22(2). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(m). inserted by No. 41/2006 s. 22(3).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114E/2.content: If a worker has not made an application to the court within one year after being notified by a Conciliation Officer that the Conciliation Officer is satisfied that there is a dispute with respect to liability to make or continue to make payments of compensation in the form of superannuation contributions under section 93CE and that an application may be made to the court to determine the matter, interest is not payable under subsection (1) in respect of the period beginning after the expiry of one year after that date and ending on the day on which the application is made. amended by Nos 47/1996 s. 18(1), 81/1998 s. 23(r). inserted by No. 47/1996 s. 18(2). inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 47.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114E/3.content: If, under section 114E, outstanding payments of Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 242 compensation in the form of weekly payments are payable in the circumstances referred to in section 114E(1)(b), (c) or (d), then, subject to section 93CE, compensation in the form of superannuation contributions under that section in respect of those outstanding payments and interest at the prescribed rate on each such payment are also payable. 114EB Alteration or termination of superannuation contributions The Authority or a self-insurer is not required to give written notice to the worker of—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114E/3/a.content: an alteration of compensation in the form of superannuation contributions where the alteration is because of an alteration in the compensation in the form of weekly payments paid or payable to the worker; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114E/3/b.content: the termination of compensation in the form of superannuation contributions where the termination is because the worker is not, or has ceased to be, entitled to compensation in the form of weekly payments.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114F.title: Recovery of payments
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114F.content:
Subdivision 1—Settlements for certain serious 
injuries suffered on or after 12 November 1997 and 
before 20 October 1999

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114F/1.content: The Authority or a self-insurer may recover from a worker, an employer or any other person any payment of compensation or other amount to which the worker, employer or other person is not entitled. (1AA) Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of provisional payments made under Division 2BA, except in the case of a payment obtained fraudulently. inserted by No. 9/2010 s. 47. inserted by No. 50/1994 s. 50. amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(m). inserted by No. 5/2021 s. 36.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114F/2.content: The Authority may recover from an employer the Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 243 (1A) If the Authority recovers from a worker any amount paid as compensation to the worker by the worker's employer to which the worker is not entitled, the Authority may reimburse that amount to the employer. amount of any penalty or cost incurred by the Authority as a result of the employer failing to pay compensation as required by the Act.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114F/3/a.content: an amount of compensation under this Act has been paid to a person in consequence of a false or misleading statement or representation or in consequence of a failure or omission to comply with a provision of this Act; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114F/3/b.content: a person is liable to pay an amount to the Authority or a self-insurer under this Act— the amount concerned is recoverable by the Authority or a self-insurer from a person in a court of competent jurisdiction as a debt due to the Authority or self-insurer.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s114F/4.content: Where an amount is recoverable from a person under subsection (3) and an amount is payable under this Act to or for the benefit of that person, the recoverable amount may be deducted from the amount so payable, despite anything to the contrary in section 97(4). inserted by No. 80/2010 s. 69(1). amended by No. 81/1998 s. 23(k)(s). inserted by No. 80/2010 s. 69(2). inserted by No. 80/2010 s. 69(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115/a.content: who suffered an injury arising out of, or This Subdivision applies to a worker— in the course of, or due to the nature of, employment on or after 12 November 1997 and before 20 October 1999; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115/b.content: who is receiving weekly payments of compensation in respect of the injury, or who would be entitled to receive such payments but for the operation of section 96(2); and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115/c.content: who has been assessed in respect of the injury as having no current work capacity and as likely to continue indefinitely to have no current work capacity; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115/d.content: who has received weekly payments in respect of the injury for at least 104 weeks; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115/e.content: who has been assessed, in accordance with sections 91 and 115C, as having a 30% or more degree of impairment in respect of the injury. /au-victoria/aca/1985/s115A.title: Right to apply for settlement
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115A.content:
(1) A worker to whom this Subdivision applies may 
apply for the settlement of his or her entitlement 
under this Act (other than Division 2B of Part IV) 
with respect to the injury. 
 (2) The application must be made in accordance with 
Subdivision 5. 
Note 
Although this Subdivision is intended to come into 
operation on the day after the Accident Compensation 
(Amendment) Act 2001 receives the Royal Assent, 
section 119(3) will have the effect of delaying the 
application process under this Subdivision.  The process can 
be delayed from starting until a date that can be no later than 
1 July 2002.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115A/1.content: A worker to whom this Subdivision applies may apply for the settlement of his or her entitlement under this Act (other than Division 2B of Part IV) with respect to the injury.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115A/2.content: The application must be made in accordance with Subdivision 5. Note Although this Subdivision is intended to come into operation on the day after the Accident Compensation (Amendment) Act 2001 receives the Royal Assent, section 119(3) will have the effect of delaying the application process under this Subdivision.  The process can be delayed from starting until a date that can be no later than 1 July 2002.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115B/1.content: The amount of the settlement is the amount resulting from applying the following formula— AB where— A is—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115C.title: Procedure for assessment of impairment
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115C.content:
For the purposes of section 115(e)— 
 (a) the worker must— 
 (i) have made a claim for compensation 
under section 98C; and 
 (ii) have had the degree of his or her 
impairment assessed under 
section 104B; and 
 (b) either— 
 (i) the worker must have advised the 
Authority or self-insurer under 
section 104B(7) that he or she accepts 
the assessments; or 
 (ii) the assessments must have been 
referred to a Medical Panel under 
section 104B(9) and the Medical Panel 
must have given its opinion in relation 
to the assessments.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115C/a.content: the worker must— For the purposes of section 115(e)— (i) have made a claim for compensation under section 98C; and (ii) have had the degree of his or her impairment assessed under section 104B; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115C/b.content: either— (i) the worker must have advised the Authority or self-insurer under section 104B(7) that he or she accepts the assessments; or (ii) the assessments must have been referred to a Medical Panel under section 104B(9) and the Medical Panel must have given its opinion in relation to the assessments.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115D/1.content: This section applies if the Authority or self-insurer is of the opinion that a worker satisfies the requirements set out in paragraphs (a), (c), (d) and (e) of section 115.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115D/2.content: The Authority or self-insurer may give the worker a written notice advising him or her—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115D/2/a.content: that it is of that opinion, as at the date of the notice; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115D/2/b.content: that he or she may be eligible to apply for a settlement under this Subdivision.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s115D/3.content: The Authority or self-insurer may only give a notice under this section on or after the relevant date (as defined in section 115E(1)). inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3. inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s116A.title: Right to apply for settlement
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s116A.content:
(1) A worker to whom this Subdivision applies may 
apply for the settlement of his or her entitlement 
under this Act (other than Division 2B of Part IV) 
with respect to the injury. 
 (2) The application must be made in accordance with 
Subdivision 5. 
Note 
Although this Subdivision is intended to come into 
operation on the day after the Accident Compensation 
(Amendment) Act 2001 receives the Royal Assent, 
section 119(4) will have the effect of delaying the 
application process under this Subdivision.  The process 
can be delayed from starting until a date that can be no later 
than 1 July 2002.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s118C/5.content: On taking effect, an Order has the like force and effect as if it were expressly enacted in this Act. Subdivision 5—Application procedure

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119/1.content: Before applying for a settlement under this Division, a worker must give a written expression of interest in applying for the settlement—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119/1/a.content: if the liability to pay compensation lies with a self-insurer, to the self-insurer; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119/1/b.content: in any other case, to the Authority.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119/2.content: An expression of interest is only valid if—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119/2/a.content: on the date it is given, the worker is eligible to apply for the settlement; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119/2/b.content: it is accompanied by any documents in relation to the identity and date of birth of the worker that are required by a direction of the Minister under section 119L. /au-victoria/aca/1985/s119A/1.content: A worker who is entitled to apply for a settlement under Subdivision 1 and who is given a notice under section 115D must give the Authority or self-insurer an expression of interest before the expiry of 12 months from the date the notice was given to the worker.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119A/2.content: A worker who is entitled to apply for a settlement under Subdivision 2 must give the Authority or self-insurer an expression of interest before the expiry of 3 months from the earliest date a valid expression of interest in applying for a settlement under that Subdivision may be lodged under section 119(4).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119A/3.content: If a worker fails to comply with subsection (1), the worker ceases to be entitled to apply for a settlement under Subdivision 1. inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/1.content: On receiving an expression of interest in applying of interest for a settlement from a worker, the Authority or self-insurer must give the worker a written response to the expression of interest.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/2.content: If the Authority or self-insurer is of the opinion that the worker is eligible to apply for the settlement, the response must include—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/2/a.content: a statement of that opinion; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/2/b.content: a statement of the amount that the worker is eligible to receive under this Division if he or she applies for the settlement and an offer of settlement is made; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/2/c.content: a statement that the Authority or self-insurer will not grant an application unless the worker obtains legal and financial advice as specified in any relevant direction of the Minister under section 119L, and a copy of any such direction; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/2/d.content: a statement— (i) that the Authority or self-insurer will pay the reasonable costs of the worker in obtaining the legal and financial advice; and (ii) of the maximum amount that will be paid with respect to the advice; and (iii) of when and how the costs of the advice will be paid; and inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/e.content: a statement that sets out the period within Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 263 which the application must be made and that states the consequences if an application is not made within that time.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/3.content: If the Authority or self-insurer is of the opinion that the worker is not eligible to apply for the settlement, the response must include—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/3/a.content: a statement of that opinion; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119B/3/b.content: a statement of the reasons why the Authority or self-insurer is of that opinion.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119C.title: Application for settlement
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119C.content:
(1) This section applies if a worker is given a 
response from the Authority or a self-insurer 
under section 119B(2). 
 (2) The worker may apply to the Authority or 
self-insurer for the settlement. 
 (3) The application must— 
 (a) be made in writing; and 
 (b) be accompanied by any certificate required 
by any direction of the Minister under 
section 119L.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119C/1.content: This section applies if a worker is given a response from the Authority or a self-insurer under section 119B(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119C/2.content: The worker may apply to the Authority or self-insurer for the settlement.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119C/3/b.content: be accompanied by any certificate required by any direction of the Minister under section 119L.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119D/1.content: A worker wishing to apply for a settlement must do so before the expiry of 6 months from the date the Authority or self-insurer gives him or her a response under section 119B(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119D/2.content: If a worker who is entitled to apply for a settlement under Subdivision 1 or 2 fails to comply with subsection (1), the worker ceases to be entitled to apply for a settlement under that Subdivision. inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3. inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119D/3.content: If a worker who is entitled to apply for a Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 264 settlement under Subdivision 3 or 4 fails to comply with subsection (1), the worker is not entitled to apply for a settlement under that Subdivision until he or she gives the Authority or self-insurer another expression of interest in applying for a settlement and is given another response under section 119B(2).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119E.title: Authority or self-insurer must respond to

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119E/1.content: On receiving an application for settlement from application a worker that complies with this Division, the Authority or self-insurer must decide whether it will offer a settlement to the worker.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119E/2.content: On making the decision, the Authority or self-insurer must give the worker written notice of the decision.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119E/3.content: If the Authority or self-insurer decides to offer a settlement to the worker, the notice must include an offer to settle for the amount advised under section 119B(2)(b).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119E/4.content: If the Authority or self-insurer decides not to offer a settlement to the worker, the notice must include a statement of the reasons why a settlement will not be offered to the worker.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119E/5/a.content: who applied for a settlement under Subdivision 1 or 2; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119E/5/b.content: who is given a notice under subsection (4)— ceases to be entitled to apply for a settlement under that Subdivision in respect of the injury. inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119F.title: Time limit on response to offer
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119F.content:
(1) If a worker wishes to accept an offer of settlement 
made by the Authority or a self-insurer, he or she 
must give the Authority or self-insurer a written 
notice accepting the offer before the expiry of 
28 days from the date the offer was given to him 
or her. 
 (2) If a worker rejects the offer, or fails to accept the 
offer within that 28 day period, the application 
lapses and the worker ceases to be entitled to 
apply for a settlement under this Division in 
respect of the injury.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119F/1.content: If a worker wishes to accept an offer of settlement made by the Authority or a self-insurer, he or she must give the Authority or self-insurer a written notice accepting the offer before the expiry of 28 days from the date the offer was given to him or her.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119F/2.content: If a worker rejects the offer, or fails to accept the offer within that 28 day period, the application lapses and the worker ceases to be entitled to apply for a settlement under this Division in respect of the injury.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119G.title: Payment and nature of settlement amounts
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119G.content:
(1) If a worker accepts an offer of settlement, the 
Authority or self-insurer must make the settlement 
payment within the time (if any) required by any 
direction of the Minister under section 119L. 
 (2) A settlement payment under this Division is a 
capital sum for loss of earning capacity.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119G/1.content: If a worker accepts an offer of settlement, the Authority or self-insurer must make the settlement payment within the time (if any) required by any direction of the Minister under section 119L.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119G/2.content: A settlement payment under this Division is a capital sum for loss of earning capacity.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/1.content: This section applies if the Authority or a self- insurer becomes aware at any time after providing the response required by section 119B, and before paying the worker a settlement amount, that the amount specified as the settlement amount in the response does not comply with this Division.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/2.content: The Authority or self-insurer must, as soon as is practicable after becoming aware that the proposed settlement amount does not comply with this Division, give the worker—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/2/a.content: a notice advising the worker that the proposed amount does not comply with this Division and explaining the effect of this section; and inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3. inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3. inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/b.content: an amended written response complying with Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 266 section 119B.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/3.content: For the purposes of section 119D(1), the relevant date is the date the worker was given the last amended response.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/4/a.content: the reason why a proposed settlement amount no longer complies with this Division is the coming into effect of a declaration made under section 115B(2) or 117B(2); and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/4/b.content: the worker has obtained legal or financial advice in respect of a response from the Authority or self-insurer that has been amended under this section; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/4/c.content: the settlement amount specified in the amended response is more than— (i) 5% greater than the last settlement amount previously advised; and (ii) $5 000 greater than that last amount— the worker is entitled to obtain further legal or financial advice at the expense of the Authority or self-insurer.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/5/a.content: a worker has obtained financial advice in respect of a response from the Authority or self-insurer that has been amended under this section; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/5/b.content: the settlement amount specified in the amended response is more than— (i) 5% greater or less than the last settlement amount previously advised; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/6.content: If the worker is given an amended response Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 267 (ii) $5 000 greater or less than that last amount— the worker is entitled to obtain further financial advice at the expense of the Authority or self- insurer. after—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/6/a.content: the worker has applied for a settlement; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/6/b.content: the worker has been offered a settlement; or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/6/c.content: the worker has accepted an offer of settlement— the application, offer or acceptance is to be treated as if it was for a settlement for the amount set out in the amended response, unless the worker gives the Authority or self-insurer a written notice, before the expiry of 42 days from the date the worker is given the amended response, stating that he or she withdraws the application or acceptance or rejects the offer (as the case may be).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/7.content: A worker to whom subsection (6) applies may give the Authority or self-insurer a written notice before the expiry of 42 days from the date the worker is given the amended response accepting an amended offer, or stating that he or she wishes the application or acceptance to proceed (as the case may be) on the basis of the amended amount.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/8.content: The Authority or self-insurer must give effect to a notice given to it under subsection (7).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119H/9.content: The rights conferred on a worker by subsection (6) are in addition to any rights conferred on the worker by section 119I(1).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119I.title: Worker may withdraw application at any time
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119I.content:
(1) A worker who has applied for a settlement under 
this Division may withdraw the application at any 
time before an offer is made by giving the 
Authority or self-insurer written notice of the 
withdrawal. 
 (2) If a worker who is entitled to apply for a 
settlement under Subdivision 1 or 2 withdraws an 
application, the worker ceases to be entitled to 
apply for a settlement under that Subdivision.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119I/1.content: A worker who has applied for a settlement under this Division may withdraw the application at any time before an offer is made by giving the Authority or self-insurer written notice of the withdrawal.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119I/2.content: If a worker who is entitled to apply for a settlement under Subdivision 1 or 2 withdraws an application, the worker ceases to be entitled to apply for a settlement under that Subdivision.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119IA/1.content: If this section applies, the Authority or a settlement avoided self-insurer may—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119IA/1/a.content: withdraw an offer of settlement made to the worker under this Division before the worker has accepted the offer of settlement;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119IA/1/b.content: if the worker has accepted the offer of settlement made to the worker under this Division and the settlement payment has not been made, avoid the settlement.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119IA/2.content: This section applies if a worker applying for a settlement under this Division has made a fraudulent or reckless misrepresentation relating to his or her circumstances or any change in his or her circumstances which would have been material to the decision of the Authority or self-insurer under section 119E whether or not to offer a settlement to the worker.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119IA/3.content: Without limiting the generality of subsection (2), the circumstances include—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119IA/3/a.content: the worker ceases to satisfy any of the eligibility criteria specified in section 115, 116, 117 or 118; inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3. inserted by No. 102/2004 s. 19.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119IA/b.content: the worker is serving a sentence of Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 269 imprisonment which would disentitle the worker to weekly payments in accordance with section 97(7);

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119IA/c.content: the worker becomes aware that any other ground for the termination of weekly payments in accordance with section 114 applies but weekly payments have not been terminated.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/1.content: A person who accepts a settlement under Subdivision 1 or 2 is not entitled, after accepting the settlement—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/1/a.content: to any further compensation or other payment under this Act (other than Division 2B of Part IV); or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/1/b.content: to recover damages in any proceedings against— (i) a person whom the Authority is liable to indemnify under section 134; or (ii) the Authority under section 134(8); or (iii) an employer who is a self-insurer or a subsidiary of a self-insurer; or (iv) an employer or the Authority; or (v) a person whom the Authority is liable to indemnify under the Accident Compensation (WorkCover Insurance) Act 1993; or (vi) the Authority under the Accident Compensation (WorkCover Insurance) Act 1993— in respect of the injury, any recurrence of the injury (other than a recurrence resulting from, or that is materially contributed to by, any inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3. amended by No. 80/2010 s. 78(o).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/2.content: Despite subsection (1), the person remains Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 270 employment engaged in after the date of the settlement) or any other injury arising out of, or in the course of, or due to the nature of, or contributed to by, any employment in which the person engaged before the date of the settlement. entitled—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/2/a.content: to compensation for medical and the like services under Division 2B of Part IV in respect of the injury; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/2/b.content: to compensation and damages in respect of any injury that was caused to the worker before the date of the settlement if that injury was not manifest on or before the date of the settlement; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/2/c.content: to compensation under section 98, 98A, 98C or 98E in respect of— (i) an injury other than the injury to which the settlement relates; or (ii) a recurrence of the injury to which the settlement relates (being an injury arising out of, or in the course of, or due to the nature of, or contributed to by, employment in which the person engaged before the date of the settlement)— if the claim for that compensation had been given, served or lodged before the date on which the person's application for the settlement was given to the Authority or self-insurer. amended by No. 80/2010 s. 78(o). amended by No. 21/2015 s. 3(Sch. 1 item 2.3).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/3.content: A person who accepts a settlement under Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 271 Subdivision 3 or 4 is not entitled, after accepting the settlement—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/3/a.content: to any further compensation or other payment under this Act (other than Division 2B of Part IV); or

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/3/b.content: to recover damages in any proceedings against— (i) a person whom the Authority is liable to indemnify under section 134; or (ii) the Authority under section 134(8); or (iii) an employer who is a self-insurer or a subsidiary of a self-insurer; or (iv) an employer or the Authority; or (v) a person whom the Authority is liable to indemnify under the Accident Compensation (WorkCover Insurance) Act 1993; or (vi) the Authority under the Accident Compensation (WorkCover Insurance) Act 1993— in respect of the injury, or in respect of any recurrence of the injury, other than a recurrence resulting from, or materially contributed to by, employment engaged in after the date of the settlement.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/4.content: Nothing in this section is intended to preclude or interfere with any right a person may have to recover compensation under the Sentencing Act 1991.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119J/5.content: In this section, recurrence includes aggravation, acceleration, exacerbation, or deterioration. amended by No. 80/2010 s. 78(o).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119K.title: Authority or self-insurer may extend or waive time

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119K/1.content: The Authority or a self-insurer may extend or limits waive any time limit specified in this Division (including a time limit imposed under subsection (4)) as it applies to a worker, on the written application of the worker.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119K/2.content: The Authority or self-insurer may only extend or waive such a time limit if it is satisfied that the worker's failure to meet the time limit was due to special circumstances.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119K/3.content: An application for the waiver of a time limit may be made at any time, either before or after the limit has expired.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119K/4.content: In extending or waiving a time limit, the Authority or self-insurer must specify in writing a new time limit within which the relevant act must be done.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119K/5.content: If the Authority or self-insurer extends or waives a time limit—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119K/5/a.content: in the case of an extension, or a waiver that is granted before the time limit expires, the worker's entitlement to apply for a settlement on the expiration of that time limit does not cease on the expiration of that time limit; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119K/5/b.content: in the case of a waiver, any entitlement to apply for a settlement that ceased on the expiry of the time limit is revived; and

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119K/5/c.content: in the case of a worker seeking a settlement under Subdivision 1 or 2, the entitlement to apply for the settlement is to cease if the worker does not do the relevant act before the expiry of the time limit specified under subsection (4). inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/1.content: The Minister may issue written directions that—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/1/a.content: require an expression of interest under section 119 to be accompanied by proof of the identity and date of birth of the worker giving the expression of interest;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/1/b.content: specify what documents may be used to satisfy such a requirement;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/1/c.content: specify the legal and financial issues in relation to a proposed settlement on which a worker must receive advice before being eligible to apply for the settlement;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/1/d.content: specify the categories of people from whom the advice may be received, or specify that the advice must be obtained from a person holding a specified minimum qualification;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/1/e.content: specify the form of certificates to be completed by legal and financial advisors to provide evidence that any advice required by a direction made under this section has been given;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/1/f.content: specify when and how the Authority or a self-insurer is to pay or reimburse a worker in relation to the worker obtaining legal and financial advice in relation to a proposed settlement;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/1/g.content: specify the maximum amounts that the Authority or a self-insurer is liable to pay a worker in respect of such advice;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/1/h.content: require a worker to provide a copy to the Authority or self-insurer of any advice obtained for the purposes of this Division, but only for the purpose of enabling a determination of the reasonable cost of the advice to be made; inserted by No. 82/2001 s. 3.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/j.content: require the Authority or a self-insurer to pay Accident Compensation Act 1985 No. 10191 of 1985 274 (i) specify the form in which an application for settlement is to be made; the settlement amount to a worker within a specified period after the worker accepts the settlement offer;

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s119L/k.content: specify that the Authority, self-insurer or a worker do anything else that is necessary or expedient to enable settlements under this Division to be dealt with fairly and efficiently. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * amended by No. 11/2002 s. 3(Sch. 1 item 4). repealed by No. 80/2010 s. 122(4). inserted by No. 67/1992 s. 31, amended by Nos 50/1993 ss 78(1)(c), 100, 35/1996 s. 453(Sch. 1 item 1.3), repealed by No. 81/1998 s. 24(2). Pt 4 Div. 3A (Heading) inserted by No. 64/1989 s. 10, repealed by No. 50/1994 s. 51(a).

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s123A.title: Notice to include statement of right of review

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s123B.title: Prohibition on recovery of certain costs
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s123B.content:
A person must not recover any costs in respect of 
assisting a person to make, lodge or forward any 
application or claim for compensation under this 
Act.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s124.title: Application of Division
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s124.content:
(1) This Division does not apply to an employer who 
is a self-insurer or a subsidiary of a self-insurer 
except in relation to the employment of a student 
worker. 
 (2) This Division does not apply to the liability to pay 
compensation in respect of an injury arising out of 
or in the course of any employment on or after 
1 July 2014.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s124/1.content: This Division does not apply to an employer who is a self-insurer or a subsidiary of a self-insurer except in relation to the employment of a student worker.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s124/2.content: This Division does not apply to the liability to pay compensation in respect of an injury arising out of or in the course of any employment on or after 1 July 2014.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s125.content:

the first five days of the period of incapacity 
resulting from the relevant injury— 
 (a) the day on which the incapacity commenced

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s125B.title: Liability to pay compensation—recovery
/au-victoria/aca/1985/s125B.content:
(1) Section 125A applies to the liability to pay 
compensation in respect of an injury arising out of 
or in the course of any employment partly before 
4 p.m. on 30 June 1993 and partly on or after 
4 p.m. on 30 June 1993. 
 (2) There is no right to contribution as between the 
Authority, employers, self-insurers or authorised 
insurers in respect of liability to which 
section 125A applies irrespective of whether the 
liability arises wholly or partly before or after 
4 p.m. on 30 June 1993. 
 (3) This section does not affect any rights conferred 
under Division 6A of this Part.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s125B/1.content: Section 125A applies to the liability to pay compensation in respect of an injury arising out of or in the course of any employment partly before 4 p.m. on 30 June 1993 and partly on or after 4 p.m. on 30 June 1993.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s125B/2.content: There is no right to contribution as between the Authority, employers, self-insurers or authorised insurers in respect of liability to which section 125A applies irrespective of whether the liability arises wholly or partly before or after 4 p.m. on 30 June 1993.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s125B/3.content: This section does not affect any rights conferred under Division 6A of this Part.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s128/3.content: The amount of the increase shall not exceed—

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s128/3/b.content: in the case of weekly payments—one-tenth of the total amount of the weekly payments accrued due at the date of the assessment of compensation.

/au-victoria/aca/1985/s128/3/c.content: in the case of weekly pensions under section 92B—one-tenth of the total amount of the weekly pensions accrued due at the date of the assessment of compensation.
